text: Amazing wine list, fantastic pizzas with unusual toppings, and gnutella crepes for dessert.  It doesn't get any better.  Not to mention that the service is excellent and friendly, and the atmosphere is comfortable and welcoming, something that you don't usually experience in a place as hip as Cibo.  I get nervous going out to trendy places because I'm scared of getting dirty looks from rich people, but this was not my experience at Cibo.  Just sitting on their patio is a relaxing experience, what with the lovely foliage, glass of wine, and beardy waiter.  I always want to go back when I've got the cash.  Great for a date or special event.

We have visited this place multiple times over the past few years and when I found out they had a private room for me and my guests I was so excited! At first they were very accommodating, they let us see the room and discuss how we were going to set it up for our party and went over the menu's with us. It came as a big surprise to me when we showed up and had to wait over an hour and a half for our first course to come out! Everything just went downhill from there. We complained to our server multiple times (we had 1 server for a party of 40) that the room was extra hot and there was nothing done about it. I had about 10 guests having to get up to try and cool down outside, fanning themselves and sweating throughout the dinner. Then when half of our guests left I realized they never sent out dessert and we had to ask for it! I was then told we should have requested dessert to come out, what kind of restaurant waits 45 minutes to bring dessert after a meal is finished?

My BIGGEST disappointment was how the catering manager, Michelle, handled everything after I sent her an email. I understand that she is the owner's wife but I've had teenagers talk to me nicer than she did. She was brash and offensive. Not only did she not take blame for anything she blamed our party for all of the issues. You can count on the fact that I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone and will have negative things to say when asked; which is unfortunate because I work downtown and a lot of people always ask me for recommendations. I sure hope the lack of customer service turns people off from dining here, you are better off going to Cheesecake Factory!

My husband and I decided to try Cibo as it was part of a "discount card" fundraiser we had signed up for & when I looked at their website/menu online, they identified themselves as "gluten free friendly" and more than happy to accommodate any allergy/dietary needs and as a GF girl, anytime an Italian place says they have GF pasta, I'm pretty happy! We dined on a Saturday evening, with reservations. 

I usually try and keep it pretty positive when it comes to reviewing restaurants but our experience was the complete opposite of positive and I hope some changes can be made their in the future because their food had some great elements & their owner was nice but other than that....ugh. 

When I mentioned that I am GF and asked if I could get the Chicken Parm but without breadcrumbs (which I would normally not even think to ask for but since they had identified themselves as being willing to accomodate allergies I went ahead and asked), I was told the chef "is busy and wouldn't want to do that but that he could just put some grilled chicken on top of the pasta but she didn't want to ask him to make it "parmesan" style, even though I'm pretty sure that would just consist of putting some sauce and cheese on top. I can understand when things are busy it is hard to accomodate special requests (even simple ones like mine) but as a customer (who is paying $20 + for dinner), I don't think I should have to worry about if my order will stress the chef out. Either don't claim to be GF friendly or get some more kitchen help? In the end, I ended up paying a pretty high price for noodles, marinara sauce & grilled chicken :( 

Our waitress only smiled when she was dropping off the check & we only smiled when we could finally leave.
Genova pizza is amazing.  Pesto that will light up your palate. Potato that smoothes each bite.  Italian brick oven pizza crust. Simply amazing. Go enjoy.

It was on a Sunday afternoon when I planted my heart in this restaurant. I didn't expect to fall in love with the décor not to mention the food...I was a little nervous ordering but after I ate their pizza my belly didn't have any bad reaction to their cheese or meat so I was relieved. I will definitely return

The service is great and atmosphere is terrific. The pizza was good, but I wasn't necessarily impressed with the crepes for dessert. Too much Nutella and not enough bananas. Appetizer we had was sub par. Personally I don't see what all the hype is with this place. Not a bad experience by any means though.

We adore this place!! The gluten free crepes are to die for!!! We always have great service and  get seated quickly. We have had a few issues with our orders but they are always willing to go above and beyond to make them right!!! Which we highly appreciate!
Best place ever! Love the Diavola and house salad! It's far from my house but well worth the 35min drive for some good pizza!

Tried Cibo for the first time with my family, recommend by my sister who loves their gluten free options. We started with a berry crepe which was delicious. Tons of berries and homemade whip cream. I ordered the Porcellino for lunch. I've always loved sandwich's and out of my top 10 favorites the Porcellino moved up to 1st place. The BBQ pork melts in your mouth with warm fontina cheese. The bread is like pizza dough and is cooked in their brick oven. Its crispy, juicy, a little spicy, and so warm. I never write reviews on yelp but for this restaurant I had to. I can't wait to visit again and try the spek or Pastrami or really any of the saltimboccas. PS the bloody Marys were soooooo good and the OJ is freshly squeezed.

Cibo is absolutely fantastic!!!

The patio is the perfect spot to enjoy their authentic pizza.  Have the quatro frommagio... it is the best I've ever had!  Love the fact that the owners are there most nights, and the staff are really fun and friendly.
Terrific little beautiful place. Intimate but not pretentious. Always delish. Love it!

Been to Cibo several times and have had no problems with the food, but what I don't go out to dinner for is a flat out RUDE server. My room mates and I went to Cibo on a thursday night and got right in as we chose to sit inside, i.e.. the place was not swamped as it is on a weekend night. We waited so long to even be helped in the first place that had to finally ask someone if we HAD a server as we would liked to have ordered a bottle of wine. When we ordered apps, as we couldn't pronounce what we wanted, we pointed it out on the menu to the server, so she clearly saw it. However when an antipasti platter came out and we said that wasn't our order, the food runner took it back to our server, who brought it back out to us and continued to argue with us that we did in fact order the antipasti, which we hadn't. Our pizza took so long we actually had time to finish the bottle of wine and could have fallen over if we'd gotten any eye contact or mention of our pizza and where it may have gone. I don't care how amazing the food or how popular the restaurant, servers with poor attitudes are never worth the time and money.

My woman took me out to go eat at this place.It was actually pretty awesome.I love the authentic atmosphere, and how fast the service is.The shop is tucked away into a little over-looked place in downtown Phoenix, and it's just wonderful...especially if you want a quiet date.



Five out of five, no doubt.

Great pizza! All of the ingredient were fresh and high quality.
Awesome patio! I didn't try the pasta, but will next time. Very cool old house converted into the restaurant. Good experience!

Ah-mazing! I love this Phoenix gem! It's my go to for celebrations, a place to take visiting guest, date night, night with the girls, all occasions! Prepare to indulge and do not count count calories.  You're eating quality ingredients with remarkable flavors.  The Barrata is superb! Smooth creamy Barrata with aged sweet balsamic vinegar and thin cuts of prosciutto on toasted bread is a must! Pizzas, oh the pizzas...are made in a wood fired oven and offer the perfect toasted yet chewy crusts. I highly recommend the Diavola if you like spice.  You can always add a touch of coolness by adding ricotta cheese. Secondly I recommend their Salsiccia con Potate. Baked chunks of seasoned potatoes with sausage and mozzarella. 

All desserts are wonderful, great coffees and homemade creamy lemoncello.  

Notes: Sunday brunch is offered with a slightly different menu. They also serve chorizo that is remarkable! They serve a pizza much like the Salsiccia con potate with pesto & onions.  Sounds strange but it's delicious! 

Homemade pastas served only 2 nights a week. Check their website. Currently it's Wed & Thurs. 

Only beer & wine; except at brunch where they offer Bloody Mary's. 

Bon Appetit!
im not a big fan of pizza, but coming to this place it changed my mind!!very fresh ingredients. so flavorful and light.  cibo you will see me here again the next time im in Phoenix!

We ate dinner Sat night this last.  I hardly eat pizza because but this was worth the carb sacrifice.  Fabulous marinara sauce with capers and anchovies.  The entry salad was huge but not overbearing.  B4 dinner the bartender gave us a couple tastes of some wines.  Place has a great vibe and excellent energy.  Our server, Marissa, did a great job and had some game taking care of us.  There were four of us and i would recommend sharing.  We live at cactus and 101st st but this was worth the road trip and will do it again soon.

My wife and her friend Nicole are gluten free and you could not tell the difference in taste of the crusts.
Very nice patio, and great food! We enjoyed a beautiful lunch here with our friends...nice view of the city skyline too! I felt like I was in Italy.
Ambiance, service, deliciousness. One of the few places I will eat gluten and dairy for. To die for. Light, quality, amazing.

Don't really have much to say, was expecting more flavor and excitement from the Calzone.....it was just like the date you been waiting for several months, then she arrives, stunning, beautiful, and sexy as hell....then she opens her mouth and starts talking-  check  please !!

Came with a large group of friends, so we ordered a few pizzas, and I had a chance to try multiple items from their menu. Not at all appetizing. Crust was dry and flavorless and the topping choices were very limited, with no good sauces to pick from. I felt I was eating a week-old bread with leaves on top. Seriously the WORST pizza I ever had (and I tried many in Mass, RI, NYC, CA, and AZ). 

I thought, well maybe at least I can enjoy some drinks and have a nice time hanging out with my friends... WRONG!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Terrible waitress service - guess she didn't have to try hard, since the tip was added to the bill due to our large group size, but still she was on the margin of being MEAN to the point I felt awkward to ask her to take our picture :/ 

This place ruined my evening out!! Usually I give restaurants another chance if something went wrong the first time, but I am never, ever coming back here - that's how bad it was.
Really good place loved it especially afternoon lunch!

Food: 3.5/5
Service: 4/5
Cleanliness: 3.5/5
Atmosphere: 3.5/5
Price: $$

We quickly looked over the menu and figured out what to order, though we got some help from our server. We decided to order a pizza and scodellinas to share as we weren't too famished. The server helped us what to pick for our scodellinas (we decided to get 5) and explained to us how it worked as well. Essentially, they were spreads that we ate on crispy bread (crostini?).

We got: White gold ricotta, Gorgonzola dolce, Prosciutto di parma, Salt roasted golden beets, and roasted eggplant. All of the spreads seemed so delicious that we had some trouble choosing - we ended up getting some recommendations from our server as well to make life easier.

All of the spreads were really delicious and I personally thought that scodellinis were a great idea! I wished more restaurants offered them as a menu. Each spread was unique and creative, and they were all very flavourful. With the crispy bread, it was the perfect dish. I highly recommend you try them - it would be great to share among friends and family, or even enjoy them all on your own depending on your preferences!

As for our pizza, we decided to try the prosciutto pizza which doesn't seem like it's on the current menu anymore, though you can add prosciutto as an extra topping to your pizza. Hubby and I both love having arugula on our pizza (our love for it starts here) and paired with prosciutto, it was just lovely. The pizza dough itself wasn't too thick or thin to our liking, and overall it was a great pizza that we would love to order again when we visit Cibo next time.
Verdict

Overall, our light dinner at Cibo was very delightful. We sat by the window and had lots of help from our server who constantly checked on us. As we had our dinner quite early, the restaurant was still rather empty but I would imagine Cibo getting very busy in the evenings! It seems pretty popular Opentable as well, as it tells me that it's been booked 40 times today at time of my search.

The casual restaurant definitely is a great place for lunch or dinner, or even for happy hour. They have a great bar as well which is great for those who love to enjoy some sports TV or a drink or two.

I highly recommend the restaurant for a casual night out with your family, friends, significant other, or even by yourself if you're in the mood.

You want great authentic Italian food at a decent price? This is the place. Every pizza on the menu is terriffic (I think we've tried them all by now) but our favorites are the Tartufata (white pizza with white truffle oil) and and Diavola. Or maybe the Quattro Formaggi and La Noce.
We ALWAYS begin with the Burrata starter. More than enough for two people. In fact, I'm tempted to ask if we can get a 1/2 order. The wine list is modest and won't make you wince when you see the prices. If you're still hungry, the Fresca from the Dolci menu is simply amazing. The fruit crepe is MORE than enough for two people.
On Tuesday and Wednesday, Chef Guido make 3 homemade pasta dishes, usually around $13-15 per plate. Amazing stuff.
The service and servers are second to none. All very friendly and helpful.
Stopped by for the first time for dessert and fell in love with the Fresca crepe! Our server Yvonne was wonderful and friendly. We will definitely be back for dinner.
Awesome food, great service, memorable experience!

For those of us who live in Phoenix, it is not a surprise to find  out that  there is an ongoing Pizza war amongst pizza aficionados. Topping the list one has to mention, in no particular order; Grimandis, Humble Pie, Cibo and Pizzeria Bianco.
From home made mozzarella , to organic sourdough and the most expensive state of the art lava and wood burning ovens, eating pizza  here in Phoenix is a serious thing.
As a  full blooded Italian,, I have to say one thing; I do not like pizza.....I lOVE IT.
And with the company of my wife, I have made an effort to try and flavor every pizza establishment in the valley.The results have been outstanding and the experiences  worth writing in my pizza diaries.
But as in beauty and love (and pizza) I guess one has to deal with subjectivity. We all have different tastes and preferences,  so when it comes to choosing the best pizza, we try to stick with originality in flavor and  the consistency of its dough..  and while trying them all, I have found exquisite flavors and combinations, different dough textures created by each unique oven, and one particular pie that distinguishes itself from all of the others  because of its simplicity and originality.
And in my eternal quest to find the most original pizza, that is the one that most closely resembles the true pizza........the one that originated in the 1830s in Napoli, baked in an oven built with lava rocks from mount Vesubio,  I have to mention two contenders; CIBO and Pizzeria Bianco.
For 15 years, Pizzeria Bianco located at 623 E Adams  street in downtown Phoenix, has been a favorite amongst pizza aficionados for making pizzas that truly resemble  a pizzeria Napolitana.
Owner, Chris Bianco , decided that the only way to create an authentic pizza, was to travel to the place of its origin, Napoli, and learn the art of pizza making.  His internship paid well and today when one eats at his pizzeria, there is no doubt that his pizzas are a very close duplicate of what one would get in Napoli.
Not even a mile apart, one finds another jewel in the pizza arena; CIBO Pizzeria.  Cibo translate simply into" the food". If you are a true pizza aficionado, you must try this pizzeria in order to truly understand the art in the making of truly artisan pizza.
Karen and Tony Martingiglio are the owners of this small and charming old house located at 603 5th ave in downtown Phoenix. It resembles a true Italian osteria.( an Italian eatery where local wines are flavored and where people come to have a great time with friends and eat home made dishes) Friendly, charming, and warm, Cibo  makes you feel at home eating with your mamma.
Pizzas here are crafted by a true transplanted pizza maker from Napoli; artisan Guido Saccone.

Pizza Margherita is probably an exact copy of what one would expect to eat in Napoli.  From the chewy lightly burned dough relieved with bubbling volcanoes,  to the simple earthy  tomato sauce and fresh basil, this pizza is heavenly.
And if I was placed in the predicament of choosing my favorite, I  would undoubtedly pick Cibo; after all there is an authentic  artisan from Napoli crafting these wonderful pies.

The only way I can describe this restaurant is perfect! After returning from Europe this summer, I have been craving a cozy atmosphere and tasty quattro formaggi pizza. I found both plus a surprise treat of excellent live jazz music. We also ordered bruschetta and crepes. Everything was exceptional!

Love this place! It gives you a relax and warming atmosphere, where you can either enjoy with your significant other or with a group of friends. Every time I been here, makes me want to jump into airplane and fly to Venice, Italy.
The pizza is decent but the standout here is the antipasto plate.  They also have some great beers and I like the small house feel to the place.  Great spot next door too, palate.

I love their mushroom pizza and their fresca dessert. Going during dinner is much better, I went during lunch and the vibe is different. The service was not as good as in the evening. 
Definetly a place to visit often.

I'm from New York, so you can bet the firs thing I asked everyone when I moved to Phoenix was "where should I get some good pizza?"  Everyone responded "Pizzeria Bianco!," but a few wise ones told me to avoid the crazy wait and check out Cibo.  Still haven't made it to Bianco, but why bother?  I've been to Cibo 3 times in the past few months and wouldn't have it any other way.

The service has always been spectacular.  There's a good selection of beer and wine, and an almost impossible-to-choose-from selection of pizzas.  We're not talking New York thin-slice sauce-and-cheese, we're talking locally sourced ingredients and artful combination.  Perfect crust topped with the perfect combination of delicious meats, cheeses, and veggies galore.

Your least favorite part of the meal will definitely be trying to pronounce the names of the pizzas.  Your favorite part of the meal might be the pizza, or it might be the ambiance (hard to decide between the cozy outside with live music and fire pit or the quaint inside that boasts everything downtown Phoenix is good at).  

Go with a group of friends and stay a while.

This place is THE BEST! The pizza is as close to authentic Italian as I've seen in Phoenix. The Prosecco is fantastic. The ambiance is cozy and inviting. This is the place to go if you want to impress guests.
Got the sausage pizza for lunch and found it to be tasty. Service was attentive and friendly, and the outdoor patio was really cute!

Some people buy their wives jewelry, flowers or a puppy to say theyre sorry.. I just take mine to Cibo. Its the ultimate spot for good vibes and insanely addicting pizza. Definetly a gem I hope never dies.
Love happy hour here! $5 for a pizza and $4 for a pint of Mill St! How can you possibly go wrong?

I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place. I have a gluten allergy and their gluten free pizza and crepes are the best in Arizona! I have never had a bad meal there. 
They also have house made limoncello!

I visited Cibo for a Iight, late dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the fresh food and beautiful patio.  The desert night sky looked lovely while I enjoyed the house salad and antipasti plate!  I hope to bring my family next time we are in Phoenix.

This place is, as the five stars suggests, as good as it gets.

If you are looking for a nice romantic dinner, Cibo offers it all. 

Great food and drinks, great location, and great atmosphere.

Phenomenal food, hands down; from the pesto salad to the calamari to the puzza, the BEST food I've had in a LONG time. I would recommend to evwryinw. The place it quaint and very friendly. The service was wonderful. You will not be disappointed.  I'll be coming back for sure!!!

I'm just going to start by saying we are 100% Italian, and moved here 1 month ago for studying purposes... We are SO grateful we found this place! The food tonight truly made us feel as if we were back at home: their ingredients are original and tasty, their meals are traditional, and we left feeling beyond satisfied. The food is cooked by a real Italian. 
We can't recommend this place enough for people that want to taste ACTUAL Italian food. 
Best Italian food you can have in town!

I was visiting Phoenix and met up with an old friend at Cibo. When I was driving down the street I was a bit concerned that my GPS had led me astray since I was driving past houses all the way up until I saw the restaurant. The unassuming location made me feel like we had found this hidden spot only the lucky few knew about. The service was spectacular. Our waiter was attentive, water glasses were always filled (much appreciated since I was not used to AZ heat), and we felt welcomed. The waiter gave us some much needed guidance with the menu since everything listed sounded unique and amazing. I decided to go with a pizza that had potatoes on it and was thrilled with my decision. Both of our pizzas were delicious and we enjoyed some suggested wine.

 I thought the meal couldn't get any better... but then we ordered the nutella and banana crepe. Seriously it was one of the best crepes I have ever had. We sat outside and the atmosphere was charming and inviting. I felt as though I was sitting in my own garden or backyard. They have twinkle lights in the trees and you feel like you should be on a movie set. Next time I am in Phoenix Cibo will be my first stop!

Absolutely loved the food, cannot put to words how good the soup, pizza, and wine was. Excellent, fresh tasting products used in their pizza. My only problem was the server was slow, seemed like he didn't know the menu well, and took roughly five minutes to open the bottle of wine. Service aside, this place has AMAZING pizza!

Finally got around to visiting Cibo last night...and didn't realize what I was missing. My advice: Just GO! Everything you are reading is true! This place really is as good as it gets. The food is fabulous, the atmosphere is charming and service is great. Yes, I could nit-pick about some of the minor details (you know how I am!), but the overall experience can't be beat. Just GO!!

Authentic Italian cuisine that never fails to deliver. The pasta specials are the closest to true Italian flavors I've found in the valley. The prices are incredibly reasonable and the ambiance is lovely.
Cibo needs no review, it's just that amazing! Service and ambiance are always spot on. It's definitely a place we frequent as a family, with friends, and any time we have guests in town.

CIBO is an open concept, 2 story restaurant with an excellent patio. You have to pay for parking but they have their own lot at the side of the restaurant. Their pizzas are amazing and they have one of the most original menus in Calgary. I'd recommend this place for date night or even a buisness lunch. The service has always been top notch as well. Definitely worth a try!

Cibo has a simple menu but its done right. I had pizza there with a friend we order two pizza and shared with left overs to take home. Though i enjoyed the food Cibo's main plus is the atmosphere. An old charming house turned into a restaurant is a cozy and inviting feel. Sit outside before the weather turns unbearable. Great place for a date or just hanging with friends. Cibo's use of architecture and food is one of the signs phoenix can move in the right direction in city life.

I was visiting from California, and only came to Cibo because it seemed like the only edible place (that had good reviews) in Arizona. The exterior was surprising, it was basically a house that was converted to a restaurant. Once you walk in you immediately feel at home. I also loved how all the awards or that they have won were placed on the wall. 

Now... on to the food. I ordered pizza, I got half Diavola and half Genova. The Diavola is Tomato sauce - mozzarella and spicy salame and the Genova was Mozzarella - basil pesto - onions - roasted potatoes and grated parmimgiano. Hands down the Diavola was probably the best pizza I have ever had in a restaurant. It is a must get! Now the Genova, was good but it could have been better. I've never had potato on my pizza before but I felt like they were a little undercooked. Besides that it was also really good and had good flavor. 

If you are visiting AZ then definitely go here, you won't be disappointed. I just hope they expand to San Diego!

Cibo is a contemporary Italian restaurant in Pittsburgh's Regent Square neighborhood.  My friend Danielle had a $10-off entrée coupon, so we decided to give it a go!  So, I did not experience a "food-gasm," but that does not mean the experience was all that bad.  The staff was welcoming and the ambiance was quaint and clean.  I cannot figure out why the word "contemporary" is an adjective used to describe their cuisine.  I had Eggplant Parmesean, which was definitely fresh (not frozen), plentiful and comforting for dinner on a cold February night in Pittsburgh.  However, my ceasar salad that preceded the main entrée was presented as large hearts of romaine that might have made their way to the grill.  I don't like salad or any parts of it warm.  That was different and possibly a "contemporary" take on Italian food.  In the end, Danielle and I enjoyed ourselves, laughing from great seats overlooking the bustling Braddock Avenue.  I would most likely not go back, as the menu was a bit over-priced.  With everything priced a la carte and also a BYOB ($5 corkage fee),  I feel Cibo's marketing theme is confusing.  That's all for now. I didn't detest the experience, nor did I LOVE it.

Visit my site for more reviews - http://wp.me/p43vGR-Ll

Had some appetizers, wine and pizza here. The food is great, especially the Scodellina and the calamari we had as appetizers. The pizza is Neapolitan style.

If I hadn't been drinking so much wine, I probably would have grown impatient with the service - our food took a long time to come out.

I'd like to come back here in the summer and try the patio.

Totally delightful. On a nice day/evening, this is the best patio to have breakfast (only on weekends), lunch or dinner. Everything is good. They have loads of vegetarian options and if something comes with meat they are down to accommodate. Some of my highlights: The Margherita pizza is legit, nuff said. Quattro Formaggio pizza add balsamic onions for a total treat that is kind of like the best french onion soup ever. The antipasto is so good (I get it without meat). The Burrata is really creamy and delicious, I sub the meat for tomatoes with pesto. Ho shi! Last recommendation, the crepes. Any of them. Oh, if the day is less than delightful, inside is completely charming as well. Basically, just go. You'll love it.

Consistent above average quality. In my book, that's a 5 star.

Is it my favorite pizza? No. But not having my favorite pizza doesn't disqualify them from a 5 star rating from me.

I love the quaint atmosphere, and the fact that the owners are there working, and interacting with the guests. I ventured out of the norm and had their calzone (I added sausage) on Friday, and I loved it.

I actually prefer their lunch menu, and wish I could get one of their wonderful sandwiches with a nice light salad for dinner. If I have one complaint it's that I can't get their sandwiches from the dinner menu.

Cibo gets repeat business from me, and that says a lot.

***ENTERTAINMENT VALUE****
It's often fun to sit outside (when it's not super hot) so that you can see people trying to head North on 5th Ave (a one-way South street at that part of town).

My last time at Cibo, I witnessed a woman with her boyfriend in the passenger seat heading West on Filmore and attempting to make a right onto 5th Ave (i.e. trying to go North). The driver behind the woman laid on his horn to get her attention. The woman was completely baffled, and her passenger contorted his body around so that he could look back that the driver behind his girlfriend and give him the finger. Heading North on Filmore, driving head-on into oncoming traffic, the woman got several more honks from cars going the right way on the one-way street. She finally took the hint, pulled into a driveway, and turned around. 5 minutes later, they took a seat with their friends, seated at the table next to mine, and sheepishly admitted to their friend that they were the ones who caused all the disturbance.

Calzone with Sausage: $15. Iced Tea: $2. Witnessing a guy defend his girlfriend's honor by flipping off some guy trying to help her only to later be almost killed by on-coming traffic: Priceless.

Cibo is the only restaurant I know that provides this type of live entertainment.

NOTE: If you are looking for a quiet spot to eat, Cibo is probably not it. If you are seated in certain parts of the house, it is often hard to hear what other people at your table are saying, and the reverberations make it possible to overhear other tables' conversations. I don't view this as something that takes away from the rating... just something the diner should be aware of about the ambiance.

Also, parking is a bit of an issue. If you don't like dealing with street parking, Cibo might not be for you. I don't like dealing with street parking, but I will for Cibo.
In my opinion this place is overrated. Margherita pizza was bland. The crust is well done, but the sauce and mozz were flavorless. Server and hostess were rude, won't be back.

I find Cibo is a hit and miss especially with the service.  While the restaurant has a nice atmosphere and the location is great I find the menu especially the current Fall/Winter 2014 to be quite weak and poorly balanced. I am definitely disappointed. Currently there are many rich and overly heavy foods and I do not feel there is balance in the menu. They no longer have creative and tasty salads for an entree nor as an option for an appetizer. There is no longer light appetizers either. We had ordered the Roasted Cauliflower as a starter and it was poorly put together and so heavy with all the cream and butter it left my stomach upset. If you like comfort food which is overly heavy and excessively oil based then this may be the place for you. If you prefer variety, taste, balance and flavour then I would recommend going elsewhere. I hope come Spring 2015 the menu is more impressive but for now I have no intention of returning.

Great atmosphere and amazing food. Love the scotellinis and pizza. Have yet to try a pasta dish! The eggplant puree is divine and my pizza favorites are the mozzerella and the pepperoni. I have tried the wild boar twice and it can be quite greasy.

Food was great, but service lacked. A 11/2 hour wait for food with one dish arriving after everyone had finished. They did comp the late dish but a bit disconcerting for the pour guy who watched everyone else eat.

This restaurant is super cute! I loved the big outside patio and all of the tree lights. We ordered a pizza, a salad, and a sandwich. The pizza was ok, it was a little burnt in spots. The salad had a fresh taste but not a lot of flavor. The truffle fries that came with the sandwich were probably the best part of the meal. I would probably give this place one more shot.
My favorite pizza in Phoenix, plus it is super romanic.
I love Cibo's!!!  Way better than Pizzeria Bianco!  Much better menu for all to choose vs just a few "fufu" items!!

Cibo hits all the right spots! Their pizza is some of the best I've had in the Valley- chewy, tender crust with that wood-fired taste and it's obvious that all of the toppings are high quality. 

Luckily I came here on a night when they were serving up handmade pasta and got to try the Orecchiette Bolognese which was delicious all around, perfectly sauced, and came with a small side salad. The portion was a bit small which was a tad disappointing for the $14ish price.

We rounded up the meal with the Banana Nutella Crepe with Ice Cream...the perfectly sweet way to end the meal! Cibo has a gorgeous patio space and live music on some nights. It was a bit chilly but there were ample heaters to keep us comfortable during our meal.

The service was a bit spotty and our waitress wasn't very sincere and seemed rushed, which was a bit irritating, but the food made up for that and that's why Cibo gets 4 stars in my book.  Will definitely be returning!

Very good healthy food! Relaxed environment for good conversation. Had a live single singing artist acoustic musician on the patio with little friendly birds to watch. I usually don't like birds because they are dirty, and leave surprises in my soda.  These were very small and the patio was clean of any bird poop. The restaurant is a little hipster-ish, but would definitely recommend for a lunch date! 5 stars!

Hi! I own the restaurant and my name is Cindy! Cindy seated or rather shoehorned us into a tiny space in the front window where we had to elbow other diners out of the way. This was our last interaction with Cindy the owner even though we were obviously less than thrilled with the table, food and service. Starter: bruschetta... Two types, one savory and
 yummy with cherry tomatoes , garlic and spice.
The other bland and under seasoned chunks of mushroom mixed with ricotta. Two types of salad... The caprese with Roma tomatoes which would have been fine but were too cold to appreciate. The same problem existed with the house Cibo salad and the too cold vegetables. Impossible to enjoy in that condition. Main courses: linguine with clams... Many of the clams were overdone and the dish was overall too spicy. Pasta with grille chicken and vodka sauce was VERY good but so freakin hot was impossible to eat for 20 minutes. Aside from the uneven food, a seven dollar charge to unscrew our(respectable white) and then not pour it at all was unacceptable. Our courses were served on top of each other with little spacing and neither of the management came to speak to us.... Probably because we were obviously not pleased with the experience. On top of all that the noise level was such I thought my head my pop off. Big hint: go eat at Il Puzziolla in Mt Lebanon to see how this should all be done.

This place is PHENOMENAL. We were driving across country from D.C. To San Diego and made a pit stop in Phoenix to have dinner here before the Suns vs Wiz game. The potato gnocchi was delicious, tender and plenty of sauce and mozzarella. We had a pizza halved between the red Diavlo and the white Tartufata, bon apetit! We sat outdoors which is somewhat secluded with the lit up treesand quiet chatter ambience. This place is a MUST! Erika was our waitress,she was superb!

My wife and I traveled to Phoenix last week to spend Spring Break with my daughter who is attending ASU. During our visit we had the "privilege" of eating at Pizzeria Bianco Tuesday night... after a 2+ hour wait. My father had suggested we go eat there after seeing this place mentioned on one of his Food Network shows. I must say the atmosphere is decent, the service so so, and the pizza just OK. 

So, the next night I took my wife to a place I had eaten at last summer named Cibo which is just a few blocks away. After the first taste of her Siena pizza she turned to me and said "this place blows away Bianco"... she is right. 

When you are there you must try the Burrata appetizer. I had the pleasure of trying it last summer when it was just added to the menu and was glad to see it stuck around. I seriously doubt there is a pizza on the menu you will not like but that night we had the Diavola as well as the Siena mentioned above (both fabulous). Make sure to finish off the evening with some homemade Limoncello and you will gladly thank me later...

We got lucky enough to find a seat on the patio and were able to dine under a perfect Phoenix sky. Our server was named Melissa and she was great. She suggested the perfect wine for our meal and was very attentive the whole time we were there. 

We cannot wait to go again!!!

Food was 3 stars.  The service was 0 stars due to Evon, our server, asking me after the meal was over why I only tipped her $5 for a $57.38 bill.  I gave her an extra $2 in cash but felt that she really did not deserve anything.  She was short with us and did not smile once.  We had 2 adults and 3 kiddos in our party.  She made us feel unwelcome and very uncomfortable.  James, another server, on the other hand was very friendly and even gave us a tip on a great ice-cream place to try out.  I gave an extra $2 for him.  I WILL NEVER EAT HEAR AGAIN AND WILL TELL ALL MY FRIENDS TO NOT COME HERE.  You make ok pizza in a quaint old house and I like your venue.  Please retrain you staff to not ask customers why they tip the way they do.  It is called a voluntarily gratuity for a reasons and I do not feel like I have to justify my tips and be interrogated.  VERY UNPROFESSIONAL.  i AM VERY SURPRISE FOR A PLACE AS NICE AS THIS.  We visited on Friday, April 12 at 12:57 PM I paid with my American Express card no. 233098. Thanks for reading.

4 stars for appearance 3 stars for food. It left me torn on whether to leave 3 stars or 4 stars but considering it's a restaurant and not a garden, I went with 3. 

Located in a small house inside of a beautiful courtyard area, you can enjoy the sounds of live music while paying a bit more than you should considering the quality of the food. 
Ordered a pizza and it was pretty "meh". Thin, not very tasty, and not crunchy even though you'd assume it would be considering how thin it was. Service was also pretty lackluster. My drink was empty for majority of the meal and I waited to use the restroom for a good 15 minutes because there was a waitress taking her break in there. If you're not a big fan of good food, go for the atmosphere. It's a cute little place. The valet was awesome since it's a pain to park in the area.
Tried about 4 different pizzas with my group and they were all delicious. Also tried a crepe with nutella which I highly recommend you save room for. Awesome outdoor patio.

Went to the fairgrounds and after the show we were hungry and anxious for a quiet spot to relax. Not knowing Phoenix well, my friend dubious asked where we should go. I suggested we Yelp it and showed her how to use Yelp.
She found this place and when I realized we were in the Willow district, I relaxed.
The ambiance couldn' t have been better. The waiter was friendly and helpful. The food was fresh, generous portions, and tasty. Lunch for two was less than $20 and there was plenty of off street parking too.

My absolute favorite pizza in my life is served here!
It's Tartufata: prosciutto + mushroom
When it gets to my table, I have to bathe in aromatic truffle steam. Instant food orgasm

This place was recommended by a friend, so we had high expectations. Very disappointed. We were told to ask for seating upstairs, because it was "quieter ". NOT. All the diners were yelling to each other to be heard over the din from other diners yelling. The noise was deafening. 
The food was not great. My stuffed veal cutlet was dry, tough, greasy, and gave every sign of having been deep fried. My wife's half rotisserie chicken was dry, she had to ask for extra sauce. Our waiter seemed to abandon us halfway. Was not to be seen when we wanted our drinks refreshed. Not going back. Suggest adding some sound absorbing tiles or tapestries upstairs.

The staff was just as wonderful as the food!

We had to wait a bit for a table on a Saturday night, but it was worth it!
My daughter and I stopped by after a day of shopping and ordered the pizza! All I can say is it was outstanding! Great atmosphere! Excellent service!
Great experience!! Food was 10/10 excellent and the half price pizza for happy hour is a must!! Host staff was pretty grumpy but once we got in and seated it was excellent!

We started with the bruschetta..it was phenomenal!  We opted for the "La Noce" pizza.  Probably one of the best pizzas I have ever had.  Lastly, for dessert we had the banana nutella with ice cream. Delicious.  I will definitely be back more sooner than later!!  Oh yeah, did I mention that the atmosphere is adorable!  I cant wait for the weather to become nicer here in Phoenix so I can sit outside on their beautiful patio.  Cibo is my new favorite restaurant.

Had read that Cibo had just reopened after a complete remodel and new chef (Jennifer Burfield - came from Cure) and menu.  So, glad we decided to try it last Saturday night.  Food was fantastic and service was warm and efficient.  Jennifer came out and spoke with us for a while and she was delightful.  The mussels with garlic, meyer lemon, white wine, fennel pollen, sumac, cream were some of the best I have had anywhere and you felt compelled to sop up the sauce with the grilled Tuscan bread.  The ravioli with a sage, butter, cream sauce was also fantastic, as was the red wine-balsamic braised beef with house made fettuccini.  BYOB with $5 corkage fee.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

This is hands down the best pizza in the valley. I lived in Rome for a month and the pizza at Cibo was better than most I had there. The wine selection here is also amazing- you can tell they really care about their selections. I just love how authentic this place is. Tutto bene! 

Seriously, I'd get married here if I could.

Absolutely wonderful experience. The food is authentic and delicious!  Service is fantastic. We've been twice and will absolutely be back. We actually ended up here after walking out of the Vig after the last bad experience we will have there. The menu is wonderful and such a beautiful patio. Try the calzone, it's amazing.

Cibo is by far my wife and I's favorite place in town.  The atmosphere is very warm and inviting, and the service has always been tremendous.  

My recommendation: If you only take one thing from this review, you must order the "Burrata" appetizer.  It's a creamy ball of mozzarella, drizzled with some balsamic vinegar, served with proscuitto and magnificent toasted bread.  

All of the pizzas we've ever ordered have been tremendous, and the dessert crepes with nutella are absolutely to die for.  You'll love this place!

Wow!!!!!!!! This is the best pizza on Earth (we went back and forth for a while between Bianco and Cibo and we finally decided on Cibo)if you like fresh ,simple ingredients and great crust instead of salty ,over topped ,greasy chain restaurant pizzas. 
We have been going for years and between our friends we tried everything on the menu. I  keep having the margherita and it is amazing.The sauce is just right,the fresh mozzarella is to die for, the the fresh basil leaves on top and the crust send me in culinary haven.
The prices are good for the quality ingredients ,atmosphere and service.
This is the pizza you dream off and can't wait to go back!!
It is wonderful to see Phoenix developing its downtown area to satisfy some of our needs to  dine in more unique,quaint  and  urban settings.
Most amazing pizza and salads! This place rocks, the service is great, and the atmosphere is perfect.

My family is Italian and we have a lot of really epic cooks in the family. Because of that, I am very picky about eating Italian in restaurants. I find myself consistently disappointed, trying Italian restaurant after Italian restaurant in Calgary, and I am so happy to report that I have actually found a place that meets my high standards! Cibo has great service, great food and a great atmosphere. I love the family style dining, and the food never disappoints! 

The bruchetta, chicken liver and prosciutto scodellina are each fantastic. The gnocci is fabulous. The pizza is amazing - I love the prosciutto pizza and the pineapple pizza in particular. The dough is perfect and I'm a huge sucker for arugula on pizza! Yum! I would recommend this place to anyone.

Well that was disappointing. The only thing Cibo did right was the pizza crust. Not exactly 100% Napolitano but it's somewhat there. My boyfriend and I ordered the Capricciosa pizza which involves "prosciutto cotto" or cooked ham. It does NOT mean "deli lunch meat/boiled American ham" which is what they topped the $16 pizza with. They need to invest in better quality ingredients and less in superficial ambiance and $300 painting. Not only is it low quality for the price, they forgot to season it! So bland and just really bad. As for the people who think their pizza is top notch, what is wrong with you? Take yourself to Italy or even New York and you'll realize how bad Cibo pizza is. #nevercomingback

I hate to give this place a great review...It's already hard enough to get a table! But it is flawless. Honestly, I cannot think of one thing that I would change about the atmosphere, service or the food. The sandwiches at lunch are absolutely incredible, they actually bake the bread for each order, then assemble your sandwich (name one other restaurant that does that). I really try to give good feedback on Yelp, but this place is flawless.

That being said, don't go into it expecting it to be flawless- you're always disappointed when you do that (like an over-hyped movie). Expect it to be a solid "8," and it will blow your mind. That's good advice that you can use in life ;-)
So good!!! This joint and Harley's Bistro in midtown have the best pizza in the city!!

Stopped in on a Thursday evening and the place was packed. The special was lasagna. Since it was too dark for my 40 something eyes to read the menu that was what I had. Thank goodness I can't see well, because the lasagna was beef-a-rific! My dinner was delicious as was my colleagues' pizza of which I bummed a taste.

Food is great. Staff was unfriendly. Went to pick up a pizza, walked in had 4 staff members sit and talk to each other while I waited for someone to acknowledge me. I say loudly "I am here for a pick up" and I have to get the pizza box myself before someone comes over for me to pay.

Quaint and adorable. Great service and the food was good. Lots of great vegetarian options  which I am not but my friend is! This is a great place for a date night or a girl's night with wine, food & chit chat!
The food was AWESOME, but the service was awful! Both my dad and I agree that we have never been treated so poorly by a waiter. The banana nutella crepes and pizza will keep me coming back though!

I hear my friends brag about this place all the time, so I decided to check it out myself.
I am kind of disappointed, I expected more...
The pizza was alright, not much of toppings, and very little cheese, I felt like I was just eating dough.
Dessert on the other hand, Nutella crepes! Delicious!! 
Service, was alright, I don't think I even got our servers name....

I am only in Phoenix for a few weeks and was hunting for something that would please the "foodie" in me.  (If traveling by public transportation), don't be discouraged by the slightly awkward walk from the light rail station (Van Buren) to the restaurant (5th and Fillmore).  Cibo sits right on the corner and is built into an old house.  Visually pleasing -- lowlight, original artwork -- I liked the ambience.  It was refreshing to get away from the contemporary desolation that is downtown Phoenix.  Granted, my friend and I dined on July 4th (a quiet night for many restaurants), but the service was wonderful.  Our server struck up conversation and seemed genuine in recommending her favorite antipasti, pizza and wine/beer combinations.  The antipasto speciale was full of interesting flavors and the Prosciutto Crudo pizza was simple yet tasty.  Great dough and black label meat is always a plus.  I stand for beer with pizza so the server pointed me to a micro brew that's right out of Tuscon (forget the name, but second of the four).  Since it was a mellow night, we were allowed to lounge outside on the patio with the Nutella and strawberries.  I probably could have gone without dessert (considering I had a few slices to take home), but my sweet tooth said otherwise.  Overall a really pleasant and peaceful experience.  I also appreciated the server's comment that contrary to popular belief, Cibo and Pizzeria Bianco are not rivals.  Rather, they endorse each other in front of guests.

We had a reservation and upon  arriving, we were seated upstairs at a bar table next to the washroom.  Every other table was empty and we asked for another table, we were told they were all reserved??  We asked, what is the difference between our reservation and the other reservations and we were told that the "computer" assigns tables and it was not possible to move...simply bizarre.  Ultimately, the manager was consulted and they found us a table outside, which was pleasant.

The food was mediocre.  The Meatballs were somewhat bland and the Ricotta with marmalade was simply that (I could have made this at home in 30 seconds).  The small quantity of polenta fries made the dish way over priced.  The ribs were slightly above average but still lacked he punch.  Overall, the flavors were fairly bland making the overall experience less than satisfactory

Overall we were definitely unimpressed.  There are so many other options, I am surprised Cibo is so complacent.

Maybe we should have tried a pizza.
Great food, atmosphere, and service. It was my first time there and I will definitely be back. Loved it!

Di Notte - fontina, pecorino, gorgonzola, mozzarella and spicy salame  

One of my top 5 pizzas of all time...and I've had it many times...doesn't dissapoint.

I'm not understanding the recent rash of lackluster reviews. CiBo is consistently awesome, tasty and efficient. Better than  Bianco without the three hour wait. Adorable setting, great staff and beautifully community minded, holding yearly fundraising events for local charities. CiBo is the real deal, and if you folks who left bad reviews don't come back? More pizza for me!

Ps- zeppoli? Heck yes.

The food is SO good but I literally ALWAYS get awful service! I complained to management for the awful and rude server we had, they respond and apologize and also offered to comp our next meal but it just has not become worth it to me considering there are plenty of other GREAT pizza places around town that also have awesome and friendly service.

This was our first time in this Pizzeria Cafe. Everything was just awesome. U need to try each n every Pizza over there. Unique taste. But my desert stole the show . Crepe Nutella with Vanilla ICeCrEaM just WOW.

I've been here twice in the last two weeks. Amazing food and great service. The ricotta tapa is a must try. I went back a second time just for that. Pizza's pretty good too. And this was the first place in the city where I found the Granville Island Winter Ale on tap this season. This place is definitely worth checking out.

We have been countless times for but lunch and dinner and have always had a wonderful experience.  The food, ambiance, and staff are incredible.  Actually, the pizza is the best I've ever had.  The Margarita is a tried and true but my new favorite is the "La Noce".
Great brunch/lunch specials... I may just drop in right now to enjoy another awesome sandwich. Their caprese, IMHO, is superior to Pane Bianco, and a better buy! Yum yum

Ok, went back last night, felt terrible because we were the late nighters, and everything was perfect. The pizza, the salads and the wine were all so nicely done. And what finally brought me to five stars was the crepe with Nuteila and Mascarpone. OMG awesome. I am now craving it the day after. Fully beats out the crepe with nutella and banana that I also adore...
Excellent wood-fired pizza in a cozy (crowded) setting that used to be a house. Have some time to spend, but worthwhile if you do.

Been to Cibo many times! Beautiful historic house, consistently great service, best pizza in the Valley. We have long-debated whether Cibo surpassed Bianco, but I no longer question that it does. Cibo is best, and reasonably priced and delicious. The burrata is also the best I have ever had, and I highly recommend it. It is extremely creamy, but holds together very well, and the balsamic drizzled across the top is phenomenal.
Great spot for some outdoor dining. Whatever else you do, make sure you order the burrata appetizer at Cibo. Just order it. Go. Hurry.

What more could you want - yummy food, cozy atmosphere & friendly service! Cibo is a great option for lunch with a large variety of salads, sandwiches both hot and cold variety's, dinner with delicious pizzas and salads and who could forget their amazing deserts. I'm a big fan of Nutella and Cibo knows how to do it right...enter Banana Nutella Crepe. I honestly thought I had died and gone to heaven! Okay, I'm slightly obsessed with Nutella but can you blame me? Cibo makes a mean pizza pie too. Give it go and you're sure to leave with a smile!

Very good pizza! It had a great selection of pizzas and appetizers. We would love to try their pasta nights sometime soon! Food came out fast, and the place was clean. Love the ambiance of the place and that it is a converted historic home in downtoan Phoenix. Definitely try it out!

3 stars for food and ambience.  Minus 1 star for service.

Cibo is the average answer to Pizzeria Bianco.  I can't believe they've even been compared  - the only similarity I can think of is geography.  The crusts are worlds apart - at least on the night we went. 

We chose to take some out of town guests to Cibo last night because of:
(1) all the praises we read on Yelp and other media
(2) the fact that it's one of the few well-regarded independent places open on a Monday night
(3) it looked cute from the outside

Apparently, other people thought the same.  All the tables for four were full inside so we took a table in the patio, which turned out to be a blessing because we got lots of privacy to talk.  

The downside though was getting the attention of the waiter.  Ice water was poured and menus were handed out as soon as we sat down but the waiter appeared over 15 min later.  When we ordered a refill on a glass of wine after the appetizer, he came with it almost at the end of our meal.

We order the antipasto speciale, large ($17) to share.  The plate was huge:  generous slices of prosciutto, 3 slices of bresaola with shaved pecorino on arugula, 4 slices of grilled zucchini,  mounds of balsamic pearl onions, giant olives, grilled red peppers with capers and parmesan, and cherry tomatoes with bocconcini and basil.

Pizzas are split between Rosse (red) and Bianche (white).  On the waiter's recommendation, we ordered these: 
- Red: Diavola (tomato sauce, mozz and spicy salame)  $13
- White: Siena (grilled zucchini, mozz, speck (smoked proscuitto) and pecorino)  $14

VERDICT: Cibo vs Pizzeria Bianco

The toppings were generous and tasty but the major complaint we had was the CRUST.  Pizza's all about the crust.  This was more like charred bread - it was not crusty in the least bit.  The dough had a nice chew to it but no crunch whatsoever.  

Chris Bianco's dough is so brilliant because there's an awesome contrast between the crusty exterior and the pillowy interior.  Chris' crust is so thin that you can inhale slice after slice but here we had trouble eating more than 2 slices.  

Even though this pizza was baked in a brick oven, there was no smokiness to it - almost as if it was flash-baked.  Pizzeria Bianco's crust not only has texture but a complex-flavored interior and smoky exterior.  Eating pizza will never be the same again...

WINNER:  Pizzeria Bianco
Lovely restaurant with great outdoor seating. I am addicted to the meatball sandwich!

This place both blows and sucks,  The antipasto appetizer is mostly grilled zucchini.  The pizza is thin crust like a quesadilla (at three times the price).  The service is horrible.  And they close at 10:00PM.  I'd rather microwave something at home than put up with this bullshit...
had a meal for eight of us on a tuesday eve service was great' food was fantastic price was reasonable will go again

Friday 6 PM.
Table of 2.
You will never run short on water as they give you a bottle on your table and promptly replace it when its out.

I got banana nutella crepes.
Additional: Vanilla ice cream ($2) and whipped cream ($2).
I wasn't told about the additional charges till the bill was presented. Surprised bunny.
$7 for the crepe, $2 for ice cream, and $2 more for whipped cream. Total 11 USD before tax and tip.

Food came out kind of slow, but it was a busy friday night.


The pizza "Latina" was okay,... I had better. All the toppings fell right off, including the cheese.
The crust was puffy and airy, and the center was extremely thin.

The server was tall handsome lanky and friendly.

The venue was loud alive, lots of ppl, had a lot of flies too, even indoors.

I liked how the windows opened to let outside air in.

It looks like a house was converted into a restaurant. The red bricks are charming.
The lawn/garden /patio is welcoming.
I liked the art on the walls. 

There's only one walk-in bathroom for both genders.

Its a nice little oasis from the hustle and bustle of downtown.

Perhaps I'll return for the crepes in the future if I happen to be in that side of town.

I've been here three times. I would say this place has the best atmosphere for early Friday evening. The best seats are outside during the springtime and if you could get the inside, it would also give the great view of the Phoenix downtown. The pizza here is made hand tossed and thin crust. Some of you may know that there is competitor near this pizza restaurant. Honestly I would choose this place over Pizzeria B.... because of the wait time there. 

In addition to Pizza, this restaurant offers variety of wine selections and locally brewed beer. If you were not driving, I would highly recommend some of the wine; it matches well with pizza! Also, the crepe here is amazing mainly because of the fresh cheese that they use to make it. IF you are fan of live music, they play sweet guitar/key board smooth jazz on Friday night at outside patio. Check this place out and let me know if you visit!

After being told there was a six hour wait at the ever popular Pizzeria Bianco in downtown Phoenix where I was planning to celebrate my birthday with a few friends last week, I remembered another wonderful place and off we went.

Cibo is in a converted 1940ish bungalow and has a yard full of beautiful trees woven with tiny lights. We got a table under a canopy of a few trees and shared four different pizzas that we chose by popular vote. I have to say that it was a hard decision since they all sounded pretty amazing. We agreed that the Diavolo was our favorite. And it didn't hurt that they had a nice wine list including Orvieto Classico which always reminds me of a favorite trip to Italy and a Salice Salintino that I always liked to share with a couple of my best friends back in my New York days. For dessert? Crepes of the Nutella and Suzette variety that we passed around.
Wonderful food, great service and fair prices. We got the flatbread and half portions of the linguine and ravioli. Outstanding!
Wonderful outdoor patio and delicious pizzas. Perfect date location.

If you have not visited Cibo yet...it's just because you must not know about this fabulous restaurant.  Last Saturday night I enjoyed an awesome dinner with my husband and a friend who had not yet been to Cibo.  We arrived at the restaurant for an 8:00 reservation and were warmly greeted by the host and immediately taken to our table. Perfect! Our waiter was there promptly, offering to open our wine and asking whether we would like water, and offering several options.  Cibo is BYOB, which we love, considering the mark up on wines in restaurants!  There is a corkage fee, which I feel is  absolutely necessary.  They have to have the proper tools, proper glasses, as well as take into account the labor it takes to clean them and replace breakage. For those who complain about that, well, obviously YOU don't own a business and don't understand that the service a restaurant provides DOES cost something!!  I read some comments about this charge, and had to comment about those uninformed remarks.  (Hello...Evan M and Becky Z!!.!!). Considering that if they had a liquor license, your $15 bottle of wine would likely cost you $35, this is a bargain!! I say this to the complainers: Stay home! There is NO corkage charge there!! 

We started with an appetizer of mussels with a yummy, creamy sauce that was so fantastic I am still thinking about it!! We love mussels and try them everywhere, but these were seriously some of the best, if not THE best I have ever had.  Better than Pointe Brugge, which was a real surprise! Cibo seerves really great bread with dipping oil, which we all dunked into this amazing sauce...Soooo goood!!!  I had a grilled shrimp dish over risotto garnished with pesto sauce on the side  that was outstanding.  My husband had the bolagnaise meat sauce over pasta, and he was really impressed...a great rating from a guy whose meatballs are literally award-winning, who makes his grandmother's sauce and home made pasta on a regular basis. My friend had the pesce de las mar, fantastic fresh pasta with an abundance of fresh seafood that she said was outstanding. We all felt like something sweet and shared a fantastic piece of cheesecake...dense,delicious and  topped with fresh berries.  Had coffe with it that was just so good you wanted more of it.  What a lovely, wonderful meal after a really long week of house hunting! Our service was friendly, efficient and tailored to us.  He made a fabulous meal just...better! Great waiter and great host, there to cater to our needs without hovering.Really amazing and damn near impossible to find in Pittsburgh!! Bravo to Cibo!!! We WILL be back!!
all for reservations.  You will LOVE this great spot in Regent Square.

If you are looking for an intimate atmosphere, great service and outstanding food, check out Cibo. Once youo've gone, you'll become a regular!!

Everything about this place was wonderful!  Neat old house with a beautiful shaded courtyard in the front. Live acoustic music played at a nice background level. Attentive, gracious wait staff. The portions are plentiful and delicious. I ordered the Calzone- enough for dinner and lunch tomorrow too. My son was able to finish his Pappardelle Bolognese but hubby has leftovers for tomorrow too. We split the Fresca dessert 3 ways-more than enough for all of us. And very reasonably priced as well.

I went to Cibo for the first time tonight and it was a very pleasant evening.

The restaurant was fairly busy for a Sunday night and we were seated at the communal table as we didn't have a reservation.

We had the olives and bruschetta to start. The olives were ok but there were a few wrinkled ones which I didn't like. I'm not sure if they were meant I be like this or just old. The bruschetta was very tasty, less tomato than I am used to and more artichoke hearts, but an interesting take non the less. I will say that the serving size was fairly small so I would probably avoid them next time.

For my main I had the Farfella pasta. It was delicious and I highly recommend it. The portion size was also very good for the price.

For dessert I shared the Dark Chocolate Date Bodini. The salted caramel sauce was very good and the cake was moist and flavourful.

I was also pleased with the price of the beer. ($4.75)

Overall the food was very good and the prices were reasonable, I can definitely see myself visiting again soon.

Delicious pizza!  Came here for pizza and a mimosa on a Sunday afternoon and had a really great experience.  We sat on the patio and it was georgous - great atmosphere and very good food.  Would love to go back to see what it's like indoors and try something different.

I hate to be critical, but really this restaurant needs to step it up. There are so many excellent urban pizzerias in the Phoenix area and this one fails in comparison. Our server was quite friendly and prompt, however it was hard to keep track of the service because we were so busy swatting flies off of our indoor table.  We ordered what the server recommended and the pizzas arrived within five minutes. The flavors were bland and the crust was soggy and wet-so much so that we did not finish our order and definitely did not take any leftovers home.  We were looking forward to advertised interesting flavor combinations and pizza that would keep is coming back. Although the decor was trendy and the patio seems accommodating and cozy, we will not be returning.

This place has great pizza.  I enjoyed the Genova (at least I am pretty sure that is the name of the pie) and it was wonderful... totally different, it had pesto, with potato and onion... Excellent.  Overall the experience was great, we visited on a Saturday night and it was very loud in the restaurant, especially because the walls are all stone and there is zero sound absorption... so it was near impossible to hear the people of my party.  Overall I would go back.

Hello..
 We eat here at least once a week. We enjoy their pizza and brunch. Specific items only, as this place can be over priced. There is a server named Tom who is severely lacking the "service industry" bone... He is by far the worst server there. He has ruined several of our experiences. To the point that we specifically request to not be seated in his area. When we complained about him we were told that he is apart of the owners family. Despite the many complaints he is still in the front of the house. So sad. His communication skills are more suited for the computer world.
Today is mother's day and I brought my family there to eat. The food was cold and we were surrounded by flies inside of the restaurant. Horrible first time experience for my family. We keep trying to give cibo the benefit of the doubt but we are running low on chances as of now. 
I work in the hospitality industry in Paradise Valley and have refrained from recommending Cibo any longer. The service and quality of food is not consistent.

This is a quaint spot, which undoubtedly was once someone's residence. You try to figure out which room is which as you walk in, picturing a TV or a sofa in the corner. You feel like you are having dinner and your buddy's house with his folks preparing a meal. We showed up for a late lunch, no wait or crowd. Pizza was fabulous. Nice texture to the crust, a little floppy so using a fork isn't out of the question. My son had the crepe, which looked amazing and tasted just as good. I would imagine parking could be beastly during a rush, since you are in a neighborhood, so plan accordingly.

CIBO is our favorite stop when we're going to be downtown. Have been several times, never had anything that wasn't great. Originally went after reading a food review that recommended the Tartufata pizza: mushrooms and white truffle oil - you've got to go at least once to try that one; it's amazing.

I first went here with my husband on Valentine's Day 3 years ago.  That was my husband's FAVORITE meal ever there, and he hasn't been pleased since unfortunately.

I wish that at lunch I could get broiled shrimp on my salad, and then I'd be here as often as I can.  I love the salads and the atmosphere.  It should be open later so we can go after the symphony and have a lovely crepe dessert and adult beverage.

Overall, our experience here was great! The food was absolutely perfect. No complaints. The place was busy and the wait staff was a bit preoccupied, so our check took a bit longer to come. Also, valet was pretty much the only way to park because the street parking was full for blocks. Music? It was amazing. The background music sounded a lot like 70's girl pop from Italy and psychedelic jam bands from the 60's-70's. 'd it!

The food was soooo good. We got a pizza and a sandwich. The pizza was so delicious I ate almost the whole thing myself. After that we got a crape with nutela. This is a must get. Definitely going here again.
Found this gem on yelp after a long drive from tombstone to Sedona. We were exhausted and hungry. The service was great and the food even better! Mangia!
Fantastic pizza! Authentic flavors straight from Italy!

Hands down the most delicious prosciutto sandwich I've ever had!  I came here for lunch and had the most delicious meal ever!  
They make their bread and it's so light and crispy- so worth the $$$ and trip!  My meal was about $9 for lunch.

Staff was friendly and quick.  They even have valet for your car!  This place is a house turned into a restaurant.  Very clean and I would 100% recommend this place!  Can't wait to come back!!!!!  Might be my go to Friday lunch spot!  

You won't be disappointed you came!

I went to Cibo the day after my birthday (which was a Friday) with friends and had an awesome experience! We had reservations for 7:45 and although we were 20 minutes late our reservations were held. We were seated upstairs where it was quite noisy and busy but my friends and I were still able to talk and have fun. Our waiter handled everything quite excellently considering how busy it was, and he was so kind as to give us our wine for half off because of my birthday! Even when we complicatedly asked for all separate bills he handled the situation very well! We started with two orders of bruschetta (which I do not recommend because they are TINY considering they're $6) and we all had pizzas, which were great and about 8 inches/personal sized. The only downsides to the restaurant were the noise and the fact that they were out of the first two wines we chose. Otherwise, I had a great time and I was very impressed with the food and service at Cibo!

Best PIZZA in town.  I love the olives and cheese pizza. I like my pizza a little burnt and they hook it up that way.  I take one pizza down on my own.

The desert is YUM.  GET THE FRESCA....

Price is also easy to swallow.  Pretty neat little spot for the family or a date.

I had heard good things about Cibo and finally decided to try it. Luckily all of the good things were true! The food was great, only "complaint" I had is that the cheese and toppings fell off as soon as you lifted a slice, but it tasted great!

The atmosphere is so cozy, inviting, and romantic. Great place for a date, or even just with friends or family. Definitely recommend the vegetarian pizza, and the Nutella banana crepes are to die for!

Just ate at Cibo for lunch. Delicious. The only reason I didn't give a 5-star was the fact that pizza wasn't on the menu for lunch. But when one door closes another opens. The food was top-notch and satisfying. Needless to say, I will be going back for dinner soon to to get the rating to a 5-star.
Best authentic Italian style pizza in town! Absolutley love the food. Long wait, but well worth it. Go knowing you are going to spend some time waiting and grab a drink. You wont regret it!
I and my 4 friends were not impressed with this place.  The pizza isn't what we feel is great pizza.  Go to La Grande Orange, Pizzaria Bianco, or Cafepino.

Let me just say that I love the atmosphere here, the outside tables, the twinkle-lights, the guy playing requests on keyboard. I spent a good long night here a couple weeks ago and had a great time. I enjoyed the pizza and the beer. There were a couple problems though. Never got offered a glass for my beer, service was slow like Monday mornings...

But I do love the neighborhood...so much so I decided to move down there :)

I had my 89-year-old mother and 22-year-old niece with me for dinner last night and I took them to CIBO.  We had an excellent time.  The food was fantastic, the staff friendly and efficient, and the environment (a bungalow-style house) was charming.  
We had another engagement so we ate early and were able to be seated immediately.  I'm told the restaurant is very busy at a later time.  We ate indoors, although the patio looked inviting as it was quiet and had misters.  
My party shared the bruschetta appetizer (two each of three different kinds, one better than the next), a pizza, and the house salad.  All were delicious.  My niece opted for dessert and chose the Nutella and marscapone crepe with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream.  (She can do that ... she's still young.)  Mom and I each had a bite and pronounced it heavenly.  I can't speak to the beverages as we just had water (which needed to be filtered).  
The meal wasn't inexpensive but most restaurants in that area are pricey (if they even serve dinner, as that is an office neighborhood with many places serving breakfast & lunch only). 
I will definitely return as my sole complaint was with the complimentary H2O.  The next time I'll pay for bottled water.

Okay, the only reason I'm not giving this place a complete 5 star is because of the I'm too good to be serving you waitress we got... I think she forgot she makes tips for a living or maybe she is rich and just works for the hell of it... either way, the food is fantastic and if you can avoid the brown hair girl medium length-  tall girl, your experience should be fantastic... love the way is all set up.

Great vibe at the restaurant and excellent service.  My friends and I had a flight to catch and asked the waitress to expedite our order.  Food was out very quick and we were done with our dinner with time to spare.  Food was good also.  Loved their thin crust pizzas!

Even after reading other Yelper's not so glowing reviews, I still wanted to try Cibo for myself. I went with 3 other friends on a Saturday with no reservations, and other than a space cadet look from our hostess before she disappeared for a couple minutes,  she came back to inform us that she had a table available.
As mentioned, the decor is nice... its a very big space, and there is a patio during summer hours.
I like how you can have a few bites and drinks, or a full meal. 
We had 5 starters to share for $18. The lamb meats balls were decent, not oo gamey tasting, the shrimp were perfectly cooked and had a fresh arugula salad with melon. As for the broccolini/boccocini/cured lemon..it was bland, and a bit rubbery.
We had the steak and a couple pizzas for our main. 
The steak was cooked medium and tender. It had a beautiful salad with heirloom tomatos and a strong parmesan cheese on the side. The portion was exactly right for 4 people. The mushroom pizza was amaaazing. We were told there was a bit of cinammon blended in with the cheese, which gave it a slightly sweet taste.The veg pizza was nice as well. Both a little thick on the crust for a thin crust pizza, but the crust is my favourite part, so no complaints on my end. 
They ( like I think everyone now) carry Phil and Sebastian coffee, so along with the panacotta, which I give 3 thumbs up as it was a delicious lemony cloud of smooth creaminess, we had a coffee. It complimented it well, as it wasnt too strong for an after dinner beverage. 
OUR SERVER: I was pleasantly suprised, our server  had GASP..personality,something that is lacking in waiting staff now days. He gave us some great recommendations on food and wine and had great product knowledge of the menu (considering they are such a new restaurant.)

This is my absolute favorite restaurant in the downtown phoenix area... Don't be tempted to eat too much for dinner since you will want lots and lots of room for the amazing crepe desert, go ahead get strawberry and banana .. You will not regret it!  
Perfect date place as well, so cute and adorable...

SIX STARS!

This is by FAR the best place I have ever experienced. Everything about it is great. The Vegetariana Pizza is a fun adventure for a couple.. and the crepes for desert are to DIE for! Vanilla ice cream, fresh strawberries, kiwi and peaches with some whipped cream in a crepe! WOWzer this place is so fun and I just love it.

Great appetizers and wine selection. Pizza was so so, a bit on the bland side. Fun and charming atmosphere. Great place to grab an appetizer/drinks and catch up with friends. Get there early. We went on a Saturday night and had to wait about 40 minutes for a table.
Spicy pep pep pizza, nutella crepe with ice cream and banana or strawberry, glass of wine, get you right in the head in the '97 sucker. Cannot vouch for anything else on their menu.

What's not to love about this place?! The food is delicious and the atmosphere is charming! 

I highly recommend the Omero Salad and the La Noce and Rustica pizza's!

On a side note, there's always been great debate among my friends as to how the name is pronounced. I went to the website tonight before I wrote this review and found the answer we've all wondering Cibo is pronounced "CHEE-boh"! 

Enjoy your visit!

The pizza is pretty tasty.  Solid thin crust italian style pie.  If i'm nitpicking they are pretty stingy on the toppings and I wish they were a dollar or two cheaper.

Biggest complaint here is the building itself.  If you get stuck inside one of those tiny little rooms that were built originally as someone's bedroom with like 7 tables be prepared to hear everyone's conversation but your own.

Ask for the crushed red pepper infused olive oil - it is glorious. Dump the crushed red pepper on that spicy sausage.  Heat lovers dream.

I was so excited to eat here based on reviews. Not sure if it was an off day but I will never go back. My server seemed mad I came in. Like I reminded him of someone he doesn't like....then we order etc etc. I get the charcuterie plate, 3 meats, 3 cheeses, 3 fruits. It came out with 4 meats (which was nice) but only 2 cheeses (1 which was a caprese salad with no basil), 2nd was the goat cheese like on the menu, and for the 3d cheese...they threw on the pear salad...but with no pears. Then the fruits! I got 3 slices of apple. Instead of 3 separate fruits, it was 3 apple slices. Instead of fruit, they sent out grilled veggies??? No. Not cool. I asked the lady for some fruit she came out with the kids fruit plate.  ok thats fine.
