The wait staff that served out table of 12-15 was so kind and extremely helpful. Our food was ready quickly and the pizzas I tasted were quite good. A little burnt dough on the bottom and very thin crust, but that wasn't enough to turn us off to the menu. Good portion sizes as well. They also brought my friend a crepe with an ice cream scoop on top as a free birthday treat. 

I'd love to come back here and sit outdoors, experience the live music, and try more of the menu. Well done Cibo!

The food is great, fresh and very tasteful... the service, not so much. As another person reviewed here, the wait staff takes your order, asks if you are ordering dessert and then takes the check... No "how is your food, can I bring you more water, would you like parm cheese w/your pizza". Nothing!!!

I've never been to a restaurant that has that much LACK of service, its amazing how many people actually come back for more bad service, I guess its because of the food, which I can understand. We had Divola pizza, great fresh cheese, salami and fresh tomatoes. For dessert we ordered a freshly made crepe, w/ marscarpone cheese and nutella.. it was heavenly!

The owners, an older couple, are very friendly and very into their place. I guess someone should complain to them about their wait staff.
Romantic, great Italian food, excellent live music, what could be better?--oh, Crepes Suzette!

best neopolitan pizza i've had in the states. The chef i believe is from caserta which is pretty cool. this is one of the only places i don't mind waiting to get seated and personally i like their food better than pizzeria bianco.

Reboot Technology Services

I have taken both my laptops and cpu's to Drew.  His turn around time is quick and the work done is always top notch.  My computers are VERY old and he keeps them running.  He has a back-up service as well.  I would not take any of my computers anywhere else.

Cibo is a great place to bring someone who doesn't know about it already you'll score some cool points for being in the know. I love the concept of a restaurant set in a historic house that in itself is cool in its own right  and the food is tasty but the service is horrible! The waiter comes to your table takes down your order and is never to be seen again till your done with your food. Grrrrr! Despite the bad service I still come back for more because i'm obsessed with the bruschetta here.  The appetizer comes with three different types of bruschetta tomato, cheese with prosciutto, and some weird bean stuff  weird but tasty. The pizza is pretty good too but I think the sauce tastes a little like ragu...really :)

Went here for lunch
Was bummed that they don't have pizza for lunch
Poo

So instead I got a sandwich and it was ok
The bread was tasty
Eh

I'm so bummed they didn't have pizza at lunch
:(

Went to Cibo's for dinner. The atmosphere was great, the waitress was awesome but, my pizza was burned black on one side and about a quarter way on the bottom. I would probably give it another chance since the appetizers were delicious and the wine selection was good.

Really good. Cute place, nice ambiance. I had their very thin crust pizza which was lovely and my friend had a sandwich that she enjoys regularly - this was my first visit. Everything appears clean, service was prompt and friendly and not overly hovering.   Will definitely return. Nice lunch place!

Mellow. We had a friend in from out of town that suggested we go here. It was way less stressful than one of the last times I was here. They now have valet (shared with to the Vig downtown). The weather was perfect so we sat outside with no wait. Great patio if the weather permits. However we got eaten alive by mosquitoes so bring bug spray. 

We tried the calamari, salad, pizza, and a pesto pasta special. Everything was good but nothing really stuck out hence the rating. Everything has cheese as the main focus on each dish so might not be a good pick for vegans. Overall, we enjoyed our mellow night out of the house.

eat anything and everything here.
Best Pizza in the Valley, hands down. 
Wonderful wine selection, great happy hour.
Great sandwiches and outdoor vibe. Could use more outdoor seating, but all in all, a good place.

Cibo has been one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix for quite some time.  It love the space, particulalry when I can eat outside.  The pizza is always good.  I'm a big fan of the Rustica.  There is a good wine list, and overall it is a place that I like to sit with friends and hang out.

Unfortunately, I can't give Cibo four or five stars becuase the service continues to be awful.  I was in the restaurant last Saturday night, it was busy and there seemed to be a complete melt down with the bar staff and the wait staff.  The Bar tender refused to serve us.  She sent us to a drab coach house in the back of the restaurant.  The Coach House did not have the full wine list available.  Really, there was not much available.  The bar tender kept dissapearing, he ran out of glasses, it was too crowded, noisy...I expect much more from a restaurant.  After we were finally seated, things improved.  

I think I'll avoid Cibo on the weekends until it can work out its service issues.

Very good spot near downtown. We got two pizzas (margherita and diavola), plus their meatballs, and the burrata with prosciutto and tomatoes. I thought everything was really good -- the pizza was floppier than I'd typically want, but still very good. The meatballs were probably the standout, although the burrata/prosciutto/tomatoes were excellent as well.

I had read Jason C's review of this place. A detailed account of why Cibo = heart break for him. Funny, sad, etc. But I thought I'd put a different twist on it since I'm not looking to leave anyone any time soon. I had a lunch meeting here instead (sorry Jason). 

We decided to eat outside on the patio and I was immediately reminded of that nuisance that is Phoenix restaurant misters in the summer. We had to move tables cause it would have been hard to have a lunch meeting, take notes, etc with our papers soaked! But really that shouldn't be a slam against Cibo per say because I know sooo many restaurants use those wasteful, ineffective, highly annoying devices.

Anyways...once we moved tables I really loved the ambience. The patio is gorgeous. I ate under a big tree that looked like you could climb in it, read a book, and be perfectly content. 

I had a salad (I can't remember the name now) with apples, candied walnuts, and gorgonzola cheese. It was delish!! The iced tea was amazing as well. Our server was really pleasant and not over attentive or too chatty, as she recognized that we were there to talk shop. 

I didn't get to poke around inside too much. But a restaurant in an old home seems to work well for Phoenix. 

We went at about 1:30pm and there was a small crowd. It seemed to be about the perfect time to hit them up. Enjoy!!

Came here after my friend Seano suggested that we try it out after Una Pizza down the road said a 1 hour wait for a table. Seano can be a bit hit and miss with his restaurant suggestions but he hit the nail on the head with Cibo. 

The dishes are served in portions (similar to tapas) so you are meant to order a few and share them amongst yourself. We ordered 4 dishes and 2 pizzas and that was more than enough for the 4 of us! 

Nice setting as well and it's big enough that I don't think you would have to worry about booking a table beforehand.

I'm really torn on how many stars to give Cibo so I'm sticking in the middle  Went there on a Tuesday night for the very first time and I absolutely fell in love with the ambiance outside.  The outside seating totally deserves 5 stars, but thats about the only 5 star I can give, if it weren't for the wonderful atmosphere I would've only given 2 stars.  

After being seated we had to wait a while for our server to come over to the table.  Not sure if he was new or just having an off night but I was not impressed with him.  I was actually jealous of the tables around us and their interactions with wonderful servers.  We explained to the server it was our first time eating there and he just started pointing to stuff and spouting off about all sorts of different pizzas, meats, cheeses, wines, etc...It was a little overwhelming and he lost me.  When we were  ready to order we had to first flag him down and interrupt his conversation with another employee.  He took our order and quickly walked away without even asking if we wanted  anything to drink.  We originally planned on getting a bottle of wine but after my boyfriend had to walk inside the building the get some service and a drink we decided against the bottle.  Very disappointing!   I'm also somewhat glad we didn't order the bottle of wine because while we were still sitting there enjoying our dinner and conversation they started clearing off our entire section and staring at us as if we were keeping the restaurant open.  Keep in mind the place was still open for 30 more minutes.  I honestly felt rushed and that I couldn't enjoy myself.  If we didn't have to wait so long, flag down our server or go in the restaurant ourselves to order a drink we may have actually finished our meal a lot sooner.  

We opted for the sausage pizza, which was good but not the best.  The mozzarella cheese was delicious and tasted very fresh, as was the crust.  But other than that I really wasn't all that impressed.  

I didn't hate the place nor did I love it.  I'd probably give it one more chance and hope that I had better service the next time around.

you'll notice from my review history that i'm not hard to please. maybe somewhat hard to impress into speaking in superlatives, but it takes a lot for me to leave a bad review. Looking at the other reviews for this restaurant I see a lot of "amazings" and equally as many 'just okays" to "wtfs".. and that's really all it is. this place is debilitatingly inconsistent. 

I've been here several times and the food is definitely overpriced but it's always been okay (neither exceptional nor offensive 'italian' fare), and the service is always lovely (thats what the points are for in this review).


Went on NYE for dinner (table of four) and I know what youre thinking "it's a busy holiday, cut them some slack!"

No. I've been there on busier fridays, and there's just no excuse for what was getting churned out of the kitchen. the wait staff is not to blame, i am entirely blaming the kitchen (and didnt undertip to punish the wait staff who were not to blame)

let's just get to the shitshow. 

arancini and lamb meatballs were fine. The lamb (i love lamb, so it's not like i can't "handle" the gamey taste) was not fresh. Arancini is very hard to screw up, and they didn't. Neither is worth the 15 dollar price tag ( 4 arancinis in some forgettable sauce, and 7 lamb meatballs that were smaller than a teaspoon.. baffling). 

Now at this point of the meal i was pretty happy because it's NYE, i was with my friends, and the ambiance and wait staff were killing it. it was overpriced but average food, which is what I already knew about this place. 

the mains is where they completely lost us. our friend's pasta was good. It wasn't 25 dollar good, but it was a comfort dish (I know i keep bringing up the price but i eat at this price point frequently and it was more like a 15/person quality of food). 

the two pizzas were both dry and not well seasoned (pear pizza and the one with mulitple meats) and the special, bison cheek (which is one of my favorite meats) was literally inedible. I always take a takeout box, i literally left my entire meal at the table in the box except the polenta which i ate, and the few bites of bison snd greens that were in my belly. 

The biscuit was inedibly dry (and I mean that, I love bread and will even eat stale bread, this biscuit was burnt and heavily over salted... which is something a salt lover like me has never said). the bison cheek was cooked well in terms of doneness but the marinade was horrific. it was very sweet (I like a mix of sweet/meat so it isn't that i'm not adventurous), the greens were underseasoned and seemed old (maybe just overcooked). I had to cut the outsides of the bison off to at least try and eat the meat less affected by the sugar they must've marinaded it in, but.... it was too far in. It was permeated into the entire chunk of meat and that bummed me out because i was famished and had saved up for this meal. very hard to screw up bison for me, but they did. i ate the polenta (hard to screw up, and they didnt) that hadn't touched the sugar meat and that was basically my meal, plus a teaspoon meatball and an arancini.

"Well Ayla, why didn't you tell them at the restaurant instead of being an asshole on the inernet"

Great question, Internet! The time between the first entree being dropped (mine) and the last (pasta) was almost 25 minutes, and the time between our appetizers being cleared and my entree being dropped was over 20 minutes as well. Now, we were in no rush as it's NYE, but we had sat and ordered by half 8 and were not out by 11, it was ridiculous. it was not even crowded and it is not the wait staff's fault. The expo or someone in the kitchen was being a stone cold disaster (I used to work on a kitchen line, you know when the mess ups is from front or back of house). 

Since it had been about 40 minutes between cleared apps and my friend getting her pasta, they should have refired the rest of our entrees or at least kept them warm. no, they dropped one plate, then dropped two pizzas, and the pasta with 5ish minutes or so between each of those things. It was baffling. the prospect of them firing up another shit meal for me after 40 minutes of not eating anything (rude to start eating until everyone has their plates when your party is only 4), i wasn't going to risk it i just wanted to dip ASAP and never return.

It sucks too because the wait staff, ambiance, and the menu on paper are so awesome, and this place is like two blocks from where I live. further, the presentation is lways great, but the food underneath it absolutely blekh. I don't see myself hemorrhaging my hard earned cash on this place ever again. In a town with so, so many amazing culinary options i will never understand how the hell this place stays open in such a prime location. they need to elevate the quality of their food to justify the price, or hopefully they'll be gone by the end of the year. i've given it so many chances and Saturday was just the straw that broke the camel's back.

I love the pizza, so far this is what I kept  coming back during happy hour.  Basil tomato and Wild Boar is my favorite. Good thing this is close to my place and can run whenever I crave. Highly recommended!

Over priced and not the best pizza in the Phoenix Metro Area. Think of it as this, Pizza Patron has better pizza than this place does. Their pizzas taste like tomato paste thrown on top of a tortilla with expensive toppings. Not worth it.

This place is so average!!!! I don't understand. I guess it has good happy hour deals and a good location but the food is so unbelievably average, ESPECIALLY if you're looking for gluten free or dairy free options. The service also sucks. Do yourself a favour and go to una or blaze pizza. Both close in proximity and incredibly better choices than this poor excuse for a pizza place. The manager literally laughed and made a face after he asked how our food was and we told him the GF/DF pizza option wasn't good. He said "ooh yeah that wouldn't be good.... our GF/DF dough is frozen and not very tasty." WHO SAYS THAT ABOUT THEY'RE OWN RESTAURANT

What a great spot! Awesome fresh made Italian food from their freshly picked salads to their delicious maple/ Neapolitan food fired pizzas yummmm!! Thus downtown spot is well worth the drive for us, I love their patio, lush with green plants and dim string lights just makes your dining experience even more romantic.
Much better than Pizzeria Bianco!  Cibo is a great date spot.

Great atmosphere. The staff is friendly and very informative . The food .. We'll ... It's amazing!! EVERYTIME I've been here it's busy, but the efficiency is remarkable. Our server Collin had the entire patio and he didn't miss a beat . I highly recommend you come on down on a Friday night sit on the patio and enjoy the environment and the live music .

We sat out on the patio for a beautiful afternoon lunch. Sandwiches were tasty. Service was slightly on the slow side. Limited menu, thought there would be more choices for lunch. Most menu items were repeated but you could choose hot or cold. We enjoyed ourselves and would recommend this place for a nice lunch downtown any time.

Cibo has fantastic wood fired pizzas, sandwiches and a to die for antipasto platter (love their desserts, too).  The setting is perfect...it reminds me of many, many restaurants in cities like Portland, OR...it is in an old converted house in one of the historic districts.  This is a great place for outside seating.  They have tables set up in the yard and the trees are all brightly lit with wrapped lights (think little white XMas lights).  The only downside for Cibo (and I can't begrudge them this) is that it is frequently really crowded, particularly on weekends.  If it weren't so crowded I would eat here all of the time!

Very cozy place, its almost a hole in the wall. We started with the meatball appetizer and OMG, it was just a perfect blend of meat and suace. 
Staff were super friendly, we had their Tuesday special and I do no remember the name, but it was great. Well not as good as the meatballs but still good.

Such a fun date spot!! Great for lunch, too! Patio is super romantic at night with the twinkle lights. Pizzas can be made 1/2 & 1/2 if you can't decide between two flavors... I couldn't! The caprese salad was delicious. Mozzarella, tomatoes & basil were super fresh. Great start to a perfectly fired pizza. Yum!

OUTSTANDING food and ambiance-- Had the proscuitto pizza and it was to die for. 

The Limoncello was fantastic, too! Definitely a trendy spot to check out in downtown Phx

In town for a very short trip when a local recommended Cibo.  It never ceases to amaze me that Phoenix is right there with NY & CT when it comes to pizza.  There has to be something in the water in that town.

The spot is in a nice residential area.  I was seated immediately.  I really love the flexibility with the pizza.  Unlike other pizza joints, they allowed me to split my pizza so that I could try different flavors.  I went with a 1/2 Salsiccia - tomato sauce, sausage and mozzarella and 1/2 Tartufata - mozzarella, prosciutto crudo, white mushrooms and a drizzle of white truffle oil after the pizza is cooked.  It is everything it had be billed. 

Service was attentive.  Price was very reasonable for what I got.  Worth the drive.

Great location and very good food. If you're looking for a patio restaurant in central phoenix, I'd highly recommend it - perfect for a date or a group of ~10-15 people (though if you're going at prime time, you'll probably want to call ahead).
The place you go to when you are not in the mood to deal with the surly crowds at Bianco.  Great setting, good pizza, and excellent desserts.

What can I say about Cibo besides... yum!

This quaint little house styled restaurant is a great hidden gem in the Downtown Phoenix area. With it's warm and romantic patio ambiance, who would not want to relax here at any point in time as long as it is not summertime... ha. When you walk in, you get that great sense of home.

However, the best part of Cibo is definitely not the decor or ambiance. it is that food. Their appetizers are a so very delicious way to begin your culinary experience here. Then when it is time to pick your main course, just start with the top and move down the list. I can guarantee that once you've eaten here you'll keep coming back for more. I know I do.

Their wines are not too pricey either which is great... especially if you can take advantage of their happy hour. it is a valued place for sure. thank you for making every experience a good one... that's why I keep on coming home to you!

I went here for dinner by myself. I went on a Friday night at 8. I had to wait maybe 20 minutes,  but it went quickly. I can tell this is a place I would come to often with my husband if we lived here, but I'm from indiana. I ordered a root beer and margharita pizza. It was ready really fast. It came to the table very hot and topped with huge basil leaves. The cheese was sparse-the way it should be. The cheese and sauce were of excellent quality.  The crust left something to be desired so I didn't eat the edges. It tasted like toast. Not bad, just not ideal. My bill was $14.50. I would definitely go back.

A side note/caution: don't walk there by yourself. It is not a well lit area and there were a few times I thought I should not be alone. This however, should not reflect poorly on the establishment.

Planned a visit back to the Valley and Cibo was my first stop after getting off the plane. The atmosphere was the first thing that impressed me. You walk up to the beautifully lit and cozily warmed outdoor seating space and either wait or get your table. We had a 5 minute wait. Not bad for a Friday night. We shared a bottle of the wine on special and ordered the Il Tagliere to share. This app is highly recommended. It was my favorite part of the meal. A wooden charcuterie board was placed in front of us filled with cured meats, olives, cheese, artichokes, walnuts, and apple. Perfect! 

I also ordered the Siena pizza. I was generally satisfied with the flavor of the crust, cheese, and toppings, however, they added the large slices of spek and zucchini after cutting the pizza which made it difficult to maneuver. Cibo is a winner. I'd be back.

This place is amazing! Perfect place to take a date. Beautiful atmosphere with a laid back vibe. I was Intensely listening to her speak.. Until I took a bite of that divalo pizza... Ooooooi that sauce! It was love at first taste. Forgot I was trying to impress a lady.. completely ignored her for roughly 5 minutes and made love to that pie. 

I had an app too. No idea what it was called but I it was fantastic! Cream filled mozz ball with tomatoes, bread and of course balsamic reduction. 

If I lived closer I'd be broke! Nough said.

Can't say enough good things about CiBO! I loved the atmosphere, the pizza was delicious (nice crispy crust with a wood fired flavor, premium toppings) and service was great. We ordered the grilled veggie plate appetizer, and though I wished it was served hot and not slightly on the cold side, it was surprisingly delicious. The drizzle of balsamic totally made the dish! 

Spring for the extra $2 for the balsamic onions on your pizza, you won't be disappointed (and I don't even like onions)!

You can't live in Phoenix and not eat at Cibo!  This is one of my favorite retaurants in the State.  It's in an old house in a historic part of downtown, tucked away in an old nieighborhood, and the food is incredible.  All of their sandwiches are perfectly done and flavorful and the service is always first class.  Very easy to get in and out quickly, and with a full belly, during the lunch hour!

If you cannot get into Pizza Bianco, come over to Cibo, or come to Cibo first and enjoy the great pizza, sandwiches, and soups made here. The ambiance here is great.  It occupies an old home built in the early 1900's and a patio that makes you feel like home. Went one Tuesday Pasta night which used to occur weekly and still does I hope and had the best pasta since my trip to Italy.  A hidden gem in downtown Phoenix.

Came here for dinner the other night with some friends who had been before. I love the look of this quaint little restaurant with it's twinkle lights decorating the tree stumps and greenery. I love their outdoor seating out front - it makes a great atmosphere. 

The staff were nice and fairly attentive. It's got a nice laid back vibe. 

We started off with a Caprese salad and I think that's why I rated this place just average. For me an Italian restaurant shouldn't ruin a caprese salad but this one was just not good. Something was seriously missing - maybe a little balsamic drizzle but it lacked all of the fresh flavors I was hoping for. The pizza I ordered on the other hand was so good. I was really bummed I couldn't bring the rest home (headed to a concert after dinner). It was the Di Norte and had a nice kick to it so you if you like a little spice in your life this is the thing to order. 

I would come back here again but it's not at the top of my list. Great if you want to sit outdoors and enjoy the nice temperature and good conversations.

This rating is based on an average from two different visits. During one visit, I went for dinner and had the most delicious pizza! The charm of this place makes you feel like you are distant from reality. The dessert wine I ordered at the end was the icing on the cake! 

However, on my next visit, I sat outside on the patio for brunch and it was not quite as great of an experience. The weather was great, but the sun was shining pretty bright so I am guessing that is why our server only came by to get our order, drop it off, and bring our tab. No refills, no feedback requested on the meal, nothing. She was a very sweet lady, she just didn't seem to want to serve our table. The food was just ok. Nothing exciting. And probably more disappointing since I had already been there once and had such an awesome experience. 

Overall, I'm not sure if I would recommend it. I recommend the pizza, but I guess it is kind of hit or miss.

Visited the Phoenix area from Chicago several times, and always wanted to try Cibo.  Glad we finally did!  My wife and I split a few things for lunch in the nice outdoor seating area.  The Alla Parmigiana sandwich with the side salad, and the Margherita pizza were all exceptional!  Definitely a return visit will be in order!

Came here to have an early valentines celebration on Monday night and it did not disappoint! The patio was romantic and even though it was a little chilly out they had plenty of heaters around. We started with a nice bottle of Chianti which was delicious. And then had the burrata which was the perfect amount for two people to share to start. Then we had the salsiccia and the diavola which were both amazing! After having an appetizer two pizzas were a little too much food but still tasty and nice to try a couple things. Service was quick and very friendly!
YUM! Best pizza. I order the truffle pizza and die each time I eat there. Heaven!!!!!

We came for dinner and it was a cute place. We weren't expecting it to be in a home, but it added to the charm. We ordered the burrata appetizer which had a ton of the cheese but not enough bread so ordered extra bread. Last time I had burrata at a restaurant the cheese was warm which I enjoyed... it was cold here but that is fine. I'm not sure what the norm is for serving it. 

Sadly, we didn't enjoy the pizza very much. We ordered it half "Tricolore" and half "Tartufata" -- the tartufata side was heavy on the truffle oil and a bit too strong/oily for me. The tricolore was okay.  If I were to come again (if I ever visit Arizona again) I think I would try the pizza Rosses over the Bianches. The bianches just sounded fantastic (these had no sauces).

Our waiter was nice. I felt bad for him trying to explain the special as it took well over a minute to describe just the soup. It was amusing as I'd hear him at each table explaining it, but what a mouthful! It sounded fantastic and we were very tempted to order it but we already had too much food.

..... And there's a new winner in town.

I really enjoy a good pie, as most of us do.  Lately, I've been finding myself at Cibo.  I use to fequent another spot in the Phoenix area for my pizza cravings however, that has all changed. 

So if your searching for  authentic Italian food, at  a reasonable price.  Look no further Cibo is the place for you. 

Every pizza on the menu at Cibo looks amazing. I cant wait to try them all.  So far my favorotes are the Salsiccia and and Diavola.  However, I would be neglectful if I  didn't' mention the calzones which are absolutely delicious, the best I ever had.

You have to start your meal with one  of Cibo's aperterisers.  Try the Arancini or Burrata, its more than enough for two people.  Cibo offers a modest  wine list at prices that  won't make you cringe  when you see them.  

The serving sizes at Cibo are very generous, however that didn't stop us from ending the night with a fruit crepe which was more than enough for two people.


The service at Cibo is second to none. The staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and accommodating. If your looking for amazing food and service, stop by you won't be disappointed.

With the heaters, the outdoor patio was perfect. It's a particularly nice patio with lots of landscaping.

We had a Tartufata pizza, which was very tasty with the Bigi wine.

Service needed a kick-start, but after that, it was very good. (I think the hostess forgot to mention us to the server.) The server proved to be very nice and attentive.

Food: 4 stars
Service: 4 stars
Ambiance: 4 stars

We really loved the ambiance of the patio. Inside looked very cozy.

Let me make your life real easy here.  When you get lucky later, you can thank me. =)

First, start off  with the Il Tagliere - Antipasto, meat, cheese and fruit board.  Or the mixed vegetables.  mmm.  Course 1 = success.

Then move on to the Caprese Salad - So fresh!   The smell itself is intoxicating.  Course 2 = winner. 

Pizza time! 

From the Pizza Bianche: Siena - mozzarella and zucchini, topped with spek and
pecorino cheese.    ahhh!  the cheese, the crunch of the zucchini.  Spek (or hold this if you aren't a fan of spek, i like it both ways).    Course 3 =  Ding Ding! 

From the Pizza Rosse: Diavola - tomato sauce, mozzarella and
spicy salame.   You simply can't go wrong here.  

Don't forget dessert! 
Crepe -  I suggest the Fresca, but you really can't go wrong with any crepe on the menu.   Course 4 = Heavenly

They have a great wine selection.  I suggest the 1/2 bottle of Moscato d' Asti if you like wines of a sweeter, bubbly nature.  

Be prepared to fall in love.  The food, the atmosphere, great service.... this is a great little house-turned-restaurant in Central Phoenix.  It was built in the early 1900s and they have done a wonderful job with the decor.  Sitting out on the patio under the sparkling white lights in the trees is a great way to add a little magic to your date night.  If you take your special someone out for dinner here, I promise that your lucky night will end just the way you hope...  Ladies and Gentlemen...you are welcome.  hehe ;-)

Yes five stars...well done Cibo...Weather you sit at small bar, inside, or great out front patio with it's well placed heat lamps I rank it above LGO in Arcadia which says something. Nestled Into a old style house in downtown Phoenix on a neighborhood street. Had one of the salads, pizza, and their berry/chocolate crepe for desert...all of it was porn food heaven...and a definite Top Ten place in Phoenix to take a date you really like. You may want to park a few blocks away to walk off the calories or hit up the dance floor at Chars has the Blues nearby.

The staff is incredibly friendly, the outdoor patio has a great relaxed, very homey, backyard chill kinda vibe. The food was excellent! We ordered the Burrata appetizer was Amazing! Very creamy burrata and nice drizzle of balsamic. We also had the Polpette which is an appetizer of 3 hearty delicious meatballs with meat sauce and nice crunchy bread. Delicious!

I ordered the Salsiccia with spicy salami and my wife orders the vegetariano. Both were very tasty, thin crust, nicely flavored sauce and crunchy edges. 

We skipped on dessert but the crepes looked awesome as well. 

Definitely on my bookmark list and will recommend to friends! Nice find!

Absolutely to die for! Margherita pizza is my weakness, and theirs is one of the best. I love all the combos and that you can do 2 flavors on one pizza. Their choices are too good to pick just one! Love their arancini during happy hour too. What a cute, quaint little spot it's in.

Tried this place on a recommendation and it was amazing! First and foremost the outside seating is the coolest we've experienced in Phoenix yet, with live music playing inside. Didn't have to wait too long on a Saturday night for a table and all the service was super friendly and attentive. Split the salad, pizza, pasta dish of the day, and crepe dessert all between the two of us and were in carb overload. But so worth it! Will most definitely be back.
Came just for the desserts... Crepes are 5 star! Adorable ambiance and very comfortable vibe. This will def be a reg go-to spot

Anytime my boyfriend and I want an incredible meal for a celebration we always end up going to Cibo. Never disappointed. 

Our anniversary, New Years, and my birthday most recently. Always consistently delicious. We normally split a bottle of Scarpetta Pinot Grigio and then the Burrata appetizer (only gripe would be that the Burrata has TONS of tomatoes on the dish recently. We miss the old days with ALL burrata!). For the pizza we normally get the Diavola. SO good! 

I am the type of person who tries lots of things on the menu first, but we found our favorites at Cibo and there's no turning back!

I have been going to Cibo pronounced "CHEE-boh"over the years. I love the unique space being located inside a house (restored 1913 bungalow), with wood floors.... gives this place a warm inviting atmosphere. The owners are often there, friendly and staff is cool, helpful..... The outside patio area is beautiful on a nice night, white lights decorate the trees adding to the ambiance and coziness of the place. I always enjoy ordering the antipasto for two to share, a pizza or two, some wine and the amazing marscapone desert. Just wish they were open for dinner on Sunday. Check this place out sometime for a unique experience.
Ordered takeout. The pizza was soggy. They seem very pretentious.

Cibo...where do I even start? Hands down the best pizzeria in Phoenix, and remains as the best pizza I've ever had. I've had nothing but great experiences with Cibo, everything I've ordered here has been amazing. The staff and owner are really friendly as well. My personal favorite pizza is the Tartufata, so good! I also really enjoy their patio and outdoor seating, looks awesome at night when all the lights are lit up.

Today was my first time at Cibo for lunch after several years of heading there for dinner.  I prefer the lunch menu.  The hot lunch sandwiches are amazing, we had the pulled pork and fried eggplant.  I very small salad comes on the side (it could use more dressing and less large onions.)  All the tables have umbrellas or are in the shade so it is a great spot to enjoy the beautiful March weather.

Not super great. We ordered a pizza with pesto, pasta dish and a sandwich. The truffle fries that came with the sandwich were the best of the meh food. I've heard people say that this place rivals Pizzeria Bianca, I disagree. But maybe it would just what we ordered, giving this place a 3 to give the benefit of the doubt. Won't be coming back though

Talk about "This Old House," - Cibo is definitely a place to try at least once.  I have to say that I was not impressed by their menu.  I happen to have a colorful palette and the food just didn't do it for me.  I did enjoy a few glasses of their house wines.  The atmosphere is nice if you're sitting closer to the front.  There's not much ambiance in the back room.  We felt a bit isolated.

we are repeat Cibo goers especially on Tuesdays when they have pasta specials.  Everything this place does is the bomb.   The cheese plate they did last time we were there was amazing.  This is a cool Romantic setting type of place, but last time we brought out 1 year old and it is family friendly too.  We just wish it was closer!  We live in Gilbert so it is a bit of a drive, but WELL worth it.  The crepe Suzette is amazing if you like marmalade.
Went here tonight with friends. We were really dissatisfied with the whole experience. Food was blah and the service was horrible. Every staff member we encountered was rude. Won't be going back.

Food is always delicious and I always leave feeling like I'm friends with my server! So friendly and good at what they do :) my husband and I always get the calamari, pear salad and share a pizza. And if we have room, a crepe. So good!

Had dinner here on my last day in Calgary since the pictures looked so good. I love how you can order different apps and we chose the roasted eggplant, arancini balls, prosciutto, and whipped ricotta. All were delicious and the portions were huge for an app. Was anticipating small plates but they came on decent sized dishes. We also ordered the mushroom and truffle pizza to share. It arrived looking so amazing -fluffy crust, melted cheese, steam rising- but unfortunately it was kind of bland. No truffle flavor to be honest. I loved the crust of the pizza though. Should have gone for one of the tomato based pizzas instead. Excited to come back and try other pizzas and pastas though!

Came here for the first time with my bf. I have to say this place can be pretty romantic if you sit outside when the lights turn on. In the daytime it's like relaxing at a friends house having a meal but come night fall it's beautiful.

There's also soft music playing in the background. On the night we went they had low jazz playing and then a live guitarist playing along with it and it make the song and entire mood so much better.

I also love that yelp allows you to join the wait list as you're on your way to go there. Perfect if you're busy and needing a table somewhere quick. I highly recommend it.

Food was delicious and reasonably priced. I had the meatball pizza, and it was fantastic. The daily special is a particularly good value, and is scheduled instead of being about clearing something out of the kitchen. Will happily come back and recommend to others.

Love dining on the cute outdoor patio. On a few occasions, there has been a live musician. 
Gluten free pizza is excellent- you almost don't realize it's gluten free. Fresh toppings were used on our pizza. 
Good pizza and wine selection as well. 
Service was prompt and friendly.

What a romantic and intimate little restaurant this is! Let me start by saying that this restaurant is the reason I signed up on yelp. I took a first date here (first time for both of us being here as well) and we both fell in love with it right off the bat. There was a little wait 15-30 on a Thursday at about 6:15pm and they don't take reservations for parties under 6 which is okay because everything made up for it. We sat on the patio and  got to watch the sun set on downtown and transition into the city lights. Clearly visible from our table was the chase tower, wells fargo, and many more. Our server was fantastic and on top of everything. Whats better than live music white lights in the trees and a view of downtown with a glass of wine. I will be back many a times A+++
Very nice atmosphere, especially outside.  Pizza was quite good, so was desert.

(I may get hate responses after this review and I contemplated in writing a POOR review of this place. After all this place is highly rated and suggested.)

Awkward, uncomfortable and RUDE is how our server made us feel with our party of only 4. We arrived during lunch time and we were the only ones at this restaurant. It was completely empty minus the employees.  We were seated immediately, but strangely our server obviously didn't want to be there at Cibo.  We informed it was our first time (at this OVERLY-hyped place) and was wondering what he would recommend? NO answer. We were interested in specials and asked if they offer anything with specials, he said NO not right now.  The server came and went numerously from our table and while we viewed the menu another party of 4 sat adjacent to us and a different server was cordial, polite and introduced himself by name, he relayed the specials of lunch and that dinner is approaching with happy hour specials.  My party and I were puzzled and said to one another, our server didn't relay any of this and why? He returned and we inquired about the specials, he said yes it's lunch still but we're approaching dinner soon. Can we still order off the lunch special menu? He said yes, but when my bf tried to order off the lunch menu our server then said "I'm trying to PUSH the dinner" and he said this Multiple times. I said, why? No response. Good for my bf when he stood firm on his decision and ordered off the lunch menu.  

Now the food: Although, the pizza was flavorful the pizzas are quiet small, more like a personal size and the dough is SUPER THIN and couldn't hold up my lightweight vegetarian ingredients. As soon as I picked up my slice the toppings immediately fell over and there was absolutely no structure support from the crust. This made it extremely challenging to eat. I folded it, rolled it and I mean this was Ridiculous.  3 of the 4 of us had the same complaints about the pizzas and quiet frankly it's not worth the price of what you get, they need to work on the portion size and their dough needs to be able to withstand light vegetables at least.  We also had the desert dough with Nutella, the dough seemed extremely stale.

Back to our server: He came and went, back and forth and every time he seemed to rush us with everything, but what's wrong with us enjoying what we have been served and enjoying our company? I finally got so irked at the server and straight up asked him "are you in a hurry to get somewhere?" He said no. I said, you sure have been acting like you do. Our server abruptly changed to someone else and without explanation. Our bill got messed up and took awhile to fix. Unsure if it was due to the change in servers.  Again, (AWKWARD).

I also wasn't sure if I should mention, yet I'm going to tell it. We sat at the corner of the restaurant where many flies were and yes we dined Indoors.  It was extremely annoying swatting them while at the dinner table.

We regret trying Cibo out. There pizza size and quality was more like an appetizer and thankfully we were asked by mutual friends to have dinner at the Federal and it was a 180 degrees a positive turn around that Cibo can take note of.  

Cibo is a cute place and I appreciate the restoration and flipping of a home into a business and their pizza is tasty, but they definitely need to improve on their customer service. Return factor: ZERO. Would I recommend it to anyone to give Cibo a shot? ABSOLUTELY NOT.

Great place in Phoenix, who knew? Cool ambiance at converted house. Sat on patio in spring; not too hot yet. Great meat & cheese plate, good pizzas. Only negative thing was atrocious live music. Really killed the ambiance.

Come for the pizza and stay for the atmosphere.  I would wager that everything on the menu is awesome but I've only been here two times now and both times I have gotten the pizza and a salad.  The Genova pizza is so good.  Its mozzarella, fresh basil and roasted potatoes.  Seriously, once you sink your teeth into it you realize what a good decision you made.  I also had the margarita pizza and it was excellent as well.  The outside seating area is so relaxing on a nice night.  It really has the whole romantic Italian restaurant thing going on and they have really good prices on beer also.  I was surprised that one of my favorite beers was available and even more surprised about the price.  I would recommend this place if you want an authentic Italian experience in a great environment.

First time in Phoenix and since we were just there for an overnight layover, we used Yelp to find something nearby that was awesome! Cibo was perfect. Indoor and outdoor seating with live music created the perfect ambiance. The Caprese salad was fresh and tasty. I also wasn't sure how big the pizzas were and we ordered our own. They were huge! Definitely order to share. Service was quick and awesome!

I came here on an evening for a food event posted through Yelp. Cibo is a part of the Creative Restaurants Group, which has several other restaurants here in Calgary, including Locolous, Scopa, Posto, Parc and Bonterra. I paid for the event and received "four" courses with a wine pairing for each. I say "four" courses because there was so much food it felt like a dozen course, and for what I paid for it was more than worth it! 

The first course was an antipasto, we were served several different types of cheese, a few plates of winter veggies, and some sliced meats. I am not a big cheese person (shocking I know), however the cheeses were light enough that I really enjoyed them and even went back for seconds (shocker again!). The first cheese was a large slice that was harder and older, with an oil drizzle, the other cheeses were gargonzola. I have had gargonzola before and was worried these would be too strong, but they were lovely! One was smoked, and the other was done normally (however that is) and paired with a cranberry sauce. The winter veggies were really nice as they added some lightness to the other foods, and paired with a creamy sauce for dipping. The veggies included roasted carrots, beets, radishes and a large head of roasted cauliflower. The meats were a warmed ham and cheese combo, and the second was a salami and greens mixture. The warm ham and cheese was my favourite of the two. 

The Primi course included a white tuffle oil pasta, a risotto and gnocchi; all heavy on the carbs here see? My favourite was definitely the truffle oil pasta, fairly oily but a nice woodsy flavour from the truffle oil. The gnocchi had onions, mushrooms and a balsamic reduction from the looks of it. The Secondi course was the main course, we were given two plates with an array of meats (pigeon, pork belly, bacon, and pulled pork) and a plate of lightly marinated arugula. By this point all of us at the table were overly stuffed. We had eaten so much over the course of the evening, but were all very satisfied as the dishes were superb and well organized! The waiters and waitresses were patient and very helpful, as well as efficient and professional the entire time. 

The last course was the dessert. We were served a hazelnut cake with a cream sauce to drizzle (or pour if you were still hungry) on, and a chocolate custard cake. Both were heavenly, the custard richer than the hazelnut cake; so by that point the hazelnut cake was my favourite as it was light and fluffy, but still rich in a sense, even without the sauce. I am looking for a recipe to replicate this masterpiece! 

Thank you to the organizers of this event, it went really well and I think everyone left more than stuffed from the tables. Job well done :D

Went here on First Friday and it was very busy. The two of us were quoted a half an hour wait, so we grabbed a drink at the bar. The bar is very small, only seats a few people but the bartenders were prompt with greeting us and making drinks. The wait was only about 10 minutes before we were seated on the patio. 

AMBIENCE - Great for a romantic date night or evening out with friends. There was a Jazz band playing, but we were still able to have a conversation.

DOG FRIENDLY PATIO

SERVICE - Extremely friendly and accommodating, on busy nights patience is necessary as the service is much slower. 

FOOD - Delicious! The calamari was cooked perfectly, the dipping sauce had a great flavor and a little bit of a spicy kick. The portions were well sized. It's a great opportunity to order several items and share as well.

What a great date night idea! So romantic and rustic at the same time. Was seated rather quickly for a busy night, saw some cute dogs on the patio, and food was served quickly. Would recommend for an affordable yet romantic date night spot... At least, more reasonable than the Vig next door! Will be going back to try a crêpe.

I went here for a date and I really liked the place.  The patio is very nice. I like the overall atmosphere as well. It's not your typical chain style restaurant. I think it may actually be in an old Craftsman house. 

Anyhow, the pizza is decent. It's not the best I've ever had, but I like it. The service was really good as well. Overall, I would come here again and I definitely recommend it for a date spot.. Especially when the weather is nice and you can take advantage of that glowing patio ambiance.

The only gripe would be that after a bottle of wine and splitting a pizza, we were asked twice if we wanted another pizza. Really? 2 pizzas in one night for 2 people? Granted they are not that big, but it's 4 pieces each. 

I didn't comment on the absurdity of the suggested portions, but as we got the check the girl said something like, "guess we're eating light tonight". I really felt like saying- "no, we're not stuffing our faces tonight and instead eating appropriate portions. Though obesity is an epidemic there is an easy preventative measure that can be taken." But, I decided against being bitchy. Perhaps she can persuade other people to take the path of heart disease.

Wow! I have been waiting so long to give a five star review. I had a Margherita pizza with prosciutto and it was amazing. The service was great! My only regret is that I didn't have more time to explore the menu. I will be back!
My experience was average at best.  The pizza ok the service was way too slow!

After receiving recommendations from locals and looking this place up online, I was super excited to check this place out.

Dined here on a Tuesday evening, it was rather busy and we were in a larger group of 7. We ended up dining outside on the patio, which I loved!

Food was great but the serving is a bit small for what you pay for. Service was and always great and will defenitely come back again. You need some starter before main course so you dont need to stop at McDonald's after.  :p..
Good food and good atmosphere. I love the patio area, quaint and inviting,
Mmmmm...went for brunch on a Sunday. Relaxing live music, shady outdoor seating, great food & service. Will definitely go back!

After 3 bad experiences at Cibo over time, each caused by pretty random circumstances, I wrote a fairly nasty, profanity-laced review of this place last night. Basically, they ran out of some of their specials, didn't tell us in a timely manner, and then annoyed us further with some schtick about their chef not liking substitutions for an alternative entree we ordered. 

In response to my review, the owner wrote me a personal message acknowledging what happened and offering a heart-felt apology. She also graciously offered to comp my meal, which I told her she didn't have to do. I have to say, with that kind of attitude by a business owner, no one can argue that she doesn't care about the place or its customers. And so, I can only conclude that I've been struck by lightning ("random crap going on with a manager or servers on a busy night" lightning) 3 consecutive times. So, I will shift my review back up to 3 stars for now (2.5 from my original review, plus a half star for sending me such a nice email), and reserve judgment for my next visit. 

In the meantime, if you look at my original reviews of this place and filter out the annoyances that seemed to pop up, all of us the pluses still remain true.

One of my favorite places to dine especially when the weather is nice. The patio is amazing! Everything I've tried is delicious. I love the pizza and I always have to follow up with dessert. It's always a pleasurable experience.

It's taken me way too long to write about one of my all-time favorite restaurants in the Valley, Cibo. I love everything about it: the phenomenal pizza, the beautiful decor, the on-top-of-things servers and the charming neighborhood location -- it's a must-try, for sure!

Cibo is in a historic home-turned-restaurant, with the most gorgeous twinkly light-lit patio (there are misters, so you can even sit here during the summer.) The interior is just as cute, with a small bar overlooking the open kitchen churning out perfect wood-fired pizzas. There's also an area that overlooks the backyard garden, and the rest of the inside seating is quaint and cozy -- you'll most likely be sat close to another table, so prepare to get intimate.

The obvious menu draw here is the pizza, and they're pretty close to perfect. You can get pizzas for dinner (their lunch menu consists mostly of sandwiches and salads.) 

A single pizza alone is a huge meal for one (though I can happily finish one myself and still manage to gobble up some dessert), so consider splitting an appetizer and sharing a pie. My favorite kind to get is a simple Margherita pizza with olives added ($12.50). The dough is always my favorite consistency -- thin and soft and with crispy edges. The fresh basil is amazing -- I love it!

Plan on having a crepe -- they're definitely a must-have if you go to Cibo. I love getting the Nutella and banana one and adding mascarpone and whipped cream to it, too ($10.50). Every bite is incredible, and it will have you coming back for more.

The atmosphere combined with the mouthwatering food solidifies Cibo as one of my go-to restaurants. It's truly a Valley gem, and I hope it stays open forever!

Cibo deserves five stars for providing the restaurant trifecta - character-filled ambiance, excellent service and delectable cuisine. 

With so many reviews, I find it hard to bring anything else to the table with mine, but Cibo is so adorable I had to write a review anyway. I visited Cibo for dinner and fell like I was swept away to an adorable village in Naples. It was dark when we arrived and upon seeing the outdoor lights sparking on the courtyard patio, I immediately felt welcomed with open arms. When walking inside, the house was singing with visitors and staff alike. It felt like a home rather than a restaurant and what a good feeling that was. Although still a bit on the warm side, we sat outside underneath a grandfather tree and between the patio decor, glistening lights and secret garden-like atmosphere, it was already a positive experience without even tasting the food. The other visitors eating outside were regulars and immediately greeted us and began offering their suggestions when they realized they were talking to first timers. During the course of the dinner we started with Bresola and wine and contemplated about the pizza. But the regulars insisted that all first timers needed to try the Genova so we went with it and they were more than right. The Genova has mozzarella, homemade basil pesto, roasted potatoes white onions and grated Parmesan. All I can say is Grazia to the regulars because they know how to point newbies in the right direction! 

Prior to visiting, I was told that Cibo beats most other pizza restaurants in Phoenix and all it took was one taste to agree. I'm adding this to resident and visitor must lists alike because I'm deeming Cibo a staple Phoenix restaurant for anyone who enters our desert oasis!

Fantastic Patio
Fantastic Pizza
Fantastic Wine
Fantastic Vibe

What more could you ask for. Need I say too much more? If you answered no....too bad. I am going to say at least a little more.  This patio with live guitar is absolutely phenomenal. Make sure to go at the right time of year for it to be a very pleasant evening. Don't skip the bruschetta and go with a group. Why you ask, so you can order quite a few pizzas and get to taste a slice of each.  Besides, pizza and wine with a good group of friends on a beautiful night on the patio...that sounds awesome.  Oh there you go, that's what more your could want, Fantastic Friends.  Well, that's on you. Cibo will provide the rest.

It seems like every time we come downtown we drive by Cibo on our way out and the place looks so busy that we decide not to stop.  Well, the Arizona Rattlers had a day game on Sunday so we stopped by Cibo for an early dinner.  The place was almost empty.  We were greeted quickly and seated in the South patio area with windows facing the dead grass in the yard and a disgusting fountain almost black from neglect.  I guess I have the type of sense of humor that doesn't appeal to everyone because our waitress treated us with a dull and lifeless demeanor almost to the point of contempt for me trying to be funny.  Our food was really no more exciting or enjoyable.  I tried the sausage pizza and my date had the Margarita.  I must admit they came out incredibly fast..... Almost too fast.  The thin crust was slightly underdone and not as crunchy as it should have been.  My date thought the taste of her pizza was bland.  I guess there just isn't much to be excited about here..... We won't be back.
The meat and cheese board is out of this world, and a great way to start the meal. Layer on top-notch pizza after that, and there are few places that compare!

This place is amazing and we have been coming for years. The patio is so beautiful and quaint and the service is good. The food is authentic and the pizza is divine. The homemade pasta is good but I promise you won't be disappointed by the pizza. I also love the house salad..its so simple yet delicious due to the fresh shaved parmesan and its so much more than a house salad. This is a great special occasion place but that doesn't mean we don't just go on a Tuesday! One tip...its pretty hot here in the summer due to it being an old house.

Ambiance was great, wine was OK, food was bad.

The pizza crust was OK but the olives and artichoke hearts were still briny from the can and overwhelmed the taste of the sauce and cheese. The "prosciutto cotto" was salty and flavorless; sliced deli meat placed in clumps around the pie. 

If you want the pizza that this place is trying to make, go to pizzeria bianco.

Let me tell you about Cibo..

We went last night after seeing Kathy Griffin so we were both in dazzeling moods having laughed all night.. well leave to someone to suck the good out of your mood right quick.

We arrived at Cibo right at 10, they close at 11. The usual host and hostess sat next to the door chatting with some friends. The waiters were sitting at the large table in the front wrapping silverware and the bartender well he just ignored us completely. Finally one of the waiters asked if wanted a table.. no we would like to stand their and smell the pizza! Duh! So we asked him to hold one moment as we used the restroom real quick. Then when we came back he was gone and we were standing there once again being ignored. Finally the bartender made a huge sigh and asked of there were only 2 of us.. so he takes us to the left dining room and there are only 2 tables in there.. guess where he sat us.. right next to a couple that looked like they getting VERY romantic.. so they gave us crusty looks.. I then asked the bartender if we could just sit at the bar (I can appreciate someone wanting space, I didn't want to sit next to them either).. so he turns and looks to me, sighed again and said "if you want".. like those words were somehow causing his hair to fall out. So I said "Oh wait, I wouldn't want to put you out!".. he then just turned and stormed towards the bar.. the Mr stopped him and said never mind.. (he didn't want him waiting on us after that little episode) so we sat next to the couple.. they looked at us like we had just interrupted a marriage proposal and she hadn't quite answered yet.

So Im mad as all heck.. Ive been treated badly before but I gotta know you before you can walk all over me! Im SO over Cibo at this point and ready to leave but the Mr talked me into staying.. he has this special talent of calming the beast, not that I turn green and tear my clothes off or anything but my tongue has been known to be very sharp! 

Waiter arrives takes our drink order.. nice wine list though very small.. he returns with the drinks and takes our dinner order.. antipasti, a rustica and a tricolore.. I asked if I could have prosciutto put on top.. you know what he says.. "Ill ask the chef if you can have that.. he doesn't like changing HIS pizza's".. I cocked my head at him (I think the vein in my forehead was ready explode) "he doesn't like to change his pizza's".. if you offer toppings on the menu for an up-charge, wouldn't you think they would actually give them to you? Talk about the dang pizza nazi! The waiter returns a few moments later or the 'chefs messenger'  (I think he was sweating) tells me that the chef has agreed to let me have the proccutio but only on a plate. Oh thank you thank you oh lord oh messiah! 

Can you believe this place?

While the food was good the attitudes here has really put me off.. so the 2 stars are for food only.. the Mr and I will never come to this place again.. Cibo has officially been scratched from our minds. Oh, I will be sending this review to them as well.. that way if they even care, which I doubt, they will address not only the bartenders attitude (little scruffy guy) but the idea that the customer pays their light bill and tells all of their friends about the place!
Amazing service and food. Quaint little European style place. Caprese salad following by white pizza.

Incredible service and delicious food. Skip the wait with Pizzeria Bianco and come here -- this is where you find great pizza in Phoenix.

Highly recommend trying the 'fresca' dessert crepe -- ice cream inside a crepe with fresh fruit and whipped cream.

I also discovered my new favorite beer: Nimbus - Dirty Blonde - perfect beer to for tolerating 100+ degree weather. Try it. It rules.

First time here, and we were both very impressed! I started with the pear salad and my wife had T&K salad. We enjoyed them, but may have gotten away with sharing one since they were generously sized. We then split a Margherita pizza, which was excellent. The sauce, OMG, the sauce! and huge basil leaves and perfect crust made for a perfect pizza. Highly recommended. I added a glass of Pinot Grigio. And our waitress Nicole took great care of us. Life is good!
The best pizza and crepes.  i had the crepe with fresh fruit and ice cream. i'm not a big crepe fan, but I crave theirs.
I love coming here with my wife. The food is typical nothing special; however, you pay for the ambiance.

Believe it. The gluten free pizza you've dreamt of has arrived. I come here for lunch when it's slow and quiet. I've had almost all of their pizzas now but my favorite is the Di Norte by far. If you're celiac then you better make this a destination meal because you will never find better :)

I will start by saying that I lived in the Northern Region of Italy for four years and I loved every minute of it. This place reminds me of the fabulous eateries throughout Italy. Not only does the restaurant have the feel of Italy but the food is simple amazing. My wife and I enjoyed the place so much that we are taking six other friends and introducing them to Cibo. I have mixed emotions about posting this. The upside of the posting is that it allows others to read about the restaurant and then indulge in its fine food and atmosphere, the downside to the posting is that the word gets out and it becomes harder and harder to get a table. Oh well , the wait is worth the reward.

I haven't yelped in quite some time so I've got alot of catching up to do.

I found Cibo via our cute little Yelp friend when I was downtown one day picking up baseball tickets.

It's interesting, and HIDDEN to say the least, I must have driven up and down 3 streets before finding the little place.

The patio was packed for lunch so I opted to sit inside and catch up on some news while sipping on a Palagrino, the server recommended the hot Italian sausage sandwich with the house salad, being that I had never been to Cibo, I followed it and was soon in love with the aroma, tangy spices and uniqueness which danced on my palate.

So why no 5 stars? 

It's a little poser-ish of Bianco, or Bianco poser-ish off of it.

Food: 3.0
Atmosphere: 5.0

I dropped by Cibo on a Friday afternoon to grab pizza with a friend. Having never been there, I didn't know what to expect, but was pleasantly surprised by the gorgeous outside patio! My friend and I were seated under a charming little tree all done up with lights and were really taken with how pretty everything looked. It was a slightly chilly night, but the outside heaters were more than adequate to help keep us warm throughout dinner. We're both cat lovers so we loved the roaming cats that were walking around the patio as well! 

Now, for the food. Let me start off by saying that I am a giant pizza FIEND. Pizza is what I crave almost all day, every day so I'm always looking for new, great places where I can get some delicious pizza! I also love arancini balls to death and basically jump up and down if I see them on a menu. When it came down to ordering, we grabbed the arancini, the margherita pizza, and the genova pizza. The arancini balls were good, but lacked a bit of inherent flavor and the margherita pizza was similar in the sense that it was good, but definitely on the blander side. The genova pizza, to me, was honestly a bad idea. The potato on the pizza was rather chunky and not sliced thin as I'd expected. Furthermore, the starchy texture of the potato mixed with the grainy texture of the pesto made it a really strange mouthful to swallow. Also be warned that the onions on this pizza are basically raw. I love onions, but there are only so many bites of raw onion that I can tolerate per meal. 

Service was good overall and we were definitely attended to quite well throughout the night. I loved this place for the patio, but not so sure about the food.

I loved this place!  Cute Christmas lights, indoor and outdoor seating (with heat lamps), and delicious (and strong) limoncello. Fabulous date night. My boyfriend's calzone was clearly burnt to a crisp on the top, which he took off. When the waitress came by to ask about the meal, he told her and she just said sorry. A little disappointing, but the freshness of the ingredients sang to me and my little pizza was perfect with asian pear, arugula, and gorgonzola. I liked it so much I had the left overs for breakfast the next day. I would love to go back. The crust also had the perfect bite and flavor. Yum!

So worth the 50 minute drive to this place. The restaurant is an old charming house. Live music was playing outside in the evening and inside had a very welcoming atmosphere. 
Let me just say.... the pizza was AMAZING! We also got the bruschetta which was perfect for two people and my husband and I were fighting over the last bite of our Nutella crepe. This place will be a staple for our weekly dinner date night.

My favorite Italian restaurant.  The staff are very friendly and the food is delicious!  The owner can be seen there from time to time and though he speaks mostly Italian, he is still funny and a pleasure to talk to.  His paintings are the ones on the inside walls of the restaurant so it gives the place a cozy vibe.  Prices are reasonable too!
One of my favorite Pies in town ! Always fresh and always the best service.

I have been here 3 times. Food is pretty tasty. Went with group of friends tried diff pizzas, salad and for dessert had crepes. Enjoyed the nice atmosphere. Great service too! A bit expensive for my budget so I don't go often.

Wow. One hour and I still do not have a simple pasta dish. Staff has told me twice I'm next in line but I don't believe it. Used to live this place but an hour for a simple pasta dish-- which I must take to go so I can make it to the theater -- is not acceptable.

I came here with a group knowing that avoiding dairy might be hard at a pizza place, but they did have pasta on the menu too.  Unfortunately the bolognese is "finished" with cheese, but that happens ahead of time so I couldn't get the pasta without cheese, so I ended up ordering a cheese-less pizza and substituting a spicy salami for the cheese at the waitresses recommendation.  I was charged extra (despite removing 3 kinds of cheese from the original order), and with the automatic gratuity (parties of 6+) I ended up spending $30 for a cheese-less pizza, a side house salad, and only drank water.
The service was pretty bad.  Maybe because our waitress knew she was getting auto gratuity she just didn't give a crap but she always seemed annoyed whenever near us, and one of our orders came out 15 min after the rest of the table (but they comped it).  
On a positive note, it has nice outdoor seating and there was a jazzy quartet playing, which I did enjoy.  I wish I would have known the pizza was going to be as large as it was.  I could have shared one and spent more money on some wine.
Best pizza in phoenix (Sorry Chef Bianco). Really affordable meal and wine! My new favorite place in phoenix.

Went here for the first time on a date. Cool early October evening so we sat outside. Beautiful ambience on the patio with lush trees and twinkling lights strung everywhere. There was a man playing acoustic guitar and singing . We ordered a white pizza with prosciutto, mozzarella, mushrooms, & white truffle oil, it was divine! Pizzas are good size & enough for two if you're not starving. The have a large selection of by the bottle wine & about 10 each of reds & whites available by the glass.

This was our first time at Cibo. The restaurant is rather large but well spaced to provide comfortable casual seating. There is a lot of outside seating. The antipasto shared plate was quite good. The arancini was really good. The pizzas are decent with good quality ingredients and pleasant flavors. Our pizzas had a bit of a battle in the oven though. The desserts were also decent. Overall it is worth a return visit and makes for another dining option in Phoenix.
Ahh...Cibo...such a great restaurant and one of my top five pizza joints in the Valley.  Great atmosphere, the service is stupendous and the food is to die for.  Why no pizza at lunch though?

Love this little treasure in downtown Phoenix! It is always busy, but fortunately the day we went was a little cold for most people to want to be on the patio so we were able to be seated immediately! The patio is beautiful, do yourself a favor and go! Romantic and charming! The food is delicious, we had the margherita pizza and finished with the Nutella crepe! Highly recommend going!!

Yelp's noting my check-ins here and asking what keeps me coming back. 

What keeps me coming back?

The burrata. A meal in itself. A perfect dish to share in such a romantic setting...smear some of the creamy, milky burrata on a toast piece and top with delicate prosciutto and chase it with super-garlicky, perfectly acidic, tiny tomatoes.

The crust. Perfectly chewy crust delivers the pizza toppings of your choice. Red or white: you can't go wrong!

The ambiance. This place has such charm! I love the setting; whether on the patio or inside, it's the kind of place you could linger and solve the world's problems over a bottle of wine and course after course of delicious food!

Parking is a nightmare but supposedly they have valet so if there's a next time, we will try that. 

Phoenix weather is starting to get manageable so it's very nice to eat outside. We came after dusk so the lights were very pretty. We were seated in the more exposed outside area... There's another side right nearby that's more enclosed and looks much cozier. 

We had a 1/2 Tartufata and Capricciosa. I wanted something familiar and tasty and that was hard to find. I chose tartufata because I like mushrooms and the prosciutto. 

Um, the pizzas were barely ok. They weren't terrible, but nothing like the reviews suggested. It's thin crust, but was floppy. The only thing telling me the two diff pizzas apart was that one had olives. I THINK there was mushrooms but I didn't taste it. The pizzas, sauce and toppings, were one homogenous thing. I HATE that when it comes to pizza. It didn't come out cheese-bubbly and charred. 

It's an expensive small pizza. It should taste better than Dominoes. I'm hoping it's a bad day because it tastes like soggy leftover pizza. No cheese stringing away after you bite it or anything. It was an even layer of firm sauce  and toppings. 

The dessert was good. We had the fresca. The sliced peaches tasted it came from a can but the rest of the fruit was fresh and the ice cream and whipped cream was good. 

One last note. It seems the server dresses in whatever they want and there are a lot of them so it's just a flurry of people walking around, all wearing regular clothing. Sometimes we didn't know if they worked there to flag them down. I went to Clever Koi recently and the staff there was so friendly and really knew their menu. The servers here were curt and disinterested. However the people cleaning up our plates after each course were prompt. 

Pros:
Ambience (though we were on the "less nice" side
Dessert

Cons:
Pizza 
Service
Good fresh food. It's mostly a pizzeria, and little to no pasta on the menu. Great deserts. Overall, a great meal.

I didn't write this review until now because I felt like our case might have been an anomaly so long ago when we went to CIBO for the first and only time. However, a friend has recently gone and had the same major incident.

Although I could write a lot more about my underwhelming experience, the most important part of this review is that CIBO does not take allergies with the utmost of seriousness, nor do they train their staff to do so.

I have a fatal allergy to nuts, which was clearly communicated to my server. She was meant to order a salad without walnuts, but delivered it with the walnuts and was unapologetic or concerned when I let her know (after taking my first bite). The rest of the evening continued to be a gong show, but to me, this was an extremely important slip-up, one that could cost my life.

I just learned last night that a friend of mine ended up in urgent care after a similar experience. It was also their first visit to the restaurant. He is extremely cautious about his nut allergy, so I know that they would have absolutely been forthcoming with their server about it.

CIBO, please educate your staff about the dangers of food allergies. All other restaurants seem to be well-versed, and often follow-up with a manager's visit to the table (unnecessary, but appreciated). Sadly, we will not return to this restaurant, as there are many other choices in the city who consider the health of their patrons their top priority.

My wife and I tried this place (pronounced as 'CHEE-BO')a few months ago and have been back at least a half-dozen times since. If you like real Italian/Naples style pizza, this is your place. While they also do a specialty pasta dish a couple days during the week, pizza is really the heart and soul of the place.

I like to dine here when the weather is nice and we can eat outside. On Friday and Saturday nights, they have a live jazz band outside. This can be a very romantic place to go and I highly recommend it for a date. 

All the deserts (except one) are using Nutella as an ingredient. I am not a fan of Nutella, but I must say the Pellani 2.0 is most excellent and only about $6. What is it? Imagine donut holes being served in a little metal basket with four wooden spears. You spear the donut hole with the little stick, then dip it in the ramekin of Nutella to your taste and enjoy! or, feed each other - very romantic.

The prices for what you get are very reasonable. Parking can be a challenge or you can use their complimentary valet.

Lot's of stuff to do downtown very close to this place (Film Bar, Angel's Trumpet, Crescent Ballroom, Breadfruit bar...too many things to do in this area that I can list here).

Highly recommended, but very limited menu. If you like REAL pizza, in a unique and romantic atmosphere and very affordable. I only wish I knew about this place sooner.
Overpriced. Tiny dishes.. Food was cold. Avoid at all costs.
This place is too small and the pizza is not memorable. I tried a shot of lemoncello and it was terrible and way too thick.

Hands down, THE BEST GLUTEN FREE PIZZA I've ever had. Cibo is a place my family comes back to again and again and never leave disappointed. Whether you eat gluten free or not, Cibo is one of the best restaurants in Arizona. 

Also, I recommend the lunch menu for the sandwiches and the crepes! Everything is amazing.
Best pizza downtown... In town! Way better atmosphere than Pomo, and better service! I LOVE CIBO! their handmade pastas are AMAZING! Great for date night!

absolutely love this little gem tucked away in a converted brick home in downtown Phoenix.  Sat at the bar and ordered a salad and pizza and was blown away by both.  The pizza has a crust that reminds me of a crustier version of naan with a tasty sauce (not too much) and salami/mozzarella.  

Great patio when the weather is nice and cozy atmosphere inside.  Two thumbs enthusiastically up!
Fantastic food and great service.  I can't wait for the weather to cool down so we can sit on the patio enjoying teh music during dinner.

This former residential dwelling is nestled in downtown and surrounded with trees. When weather permits you should definitely dine outside. The service was great. The arugula pear salad is the business, light, crisp and delicious. I got a regular cheese pizza nothing fancy. Love the thin crust! Leave room for dessert, I'm glad I did. I love Cibo and will be back soon.

Wow! We had the best experience here this afternoon! The food was fantastic and the service was phenomenal. My husband and I sat at the bar and Angie was our server. She offered suggestions and was wonderful to have conversation with. If you're looking for incredible food, great atmosphere and dynamic service, you must try Cibo and ask for Angie!
Went in 2012 loved it havnt been since but When I drive by its always busy. Food was pretty amazing.
Best pizza in Phoenix, fun experience, small rooms and tables but the food is the well worth it.

Whether seated inside amongst the eclectic decor or outside amongst the lit trees and occasional musician, Cibo is always an enjoyable experience. The experience includes a delicious array of salads and antipastis, a savory wine selection, brick oven pizza, lattes and desserts. In my opinion, you cannot go wrong with any item on the menu. P.S. Brunch is also a delightful affair.

I was skeptical about coming here as the place was pretty small. We came here on Friday night for dinner with a party of three. There were two tables outside if you preferred sitting outside to enjoy the weather. The place was small but a lot of people were there enjoying their food. BTW, this is a BYOB place which is a plus!! 

We started with an appetizer which was a seafood platter of shrimp, calamari,  anchovies and something else. They had run out of calamari so the gave us a bit more of everything else.  I did like it but not the anchovies. I was actually looking forward for the calamari. I ordered the linguini with seafood and my friends ordered the red snapper which was the special of the day. I LOVE the dish that I got as the pasta had a spicy kick to it. However, my friends food was not that great. The fish was undercooked and they didn't like how the rice taste. The waiter took the dishes back and they were able to ordered something else. I do have to say that the dishes were pretty small. 

I would definitely go back for more pasta!
